not in Cic., Caes., or Quint.). </sense><sense id="n12791.7" n="A" level="2"> With respect to the term. <hi rend="ital">a quo, from this time forth, henceforth, henceforwards</hi> (in the future, opp. abhinc). </sense><sense id="n12791.8" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum futuro</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ante quidem mentitus est, nunc jam dehinc erit verax tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 161</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">at ut scias, nunc dehinc latine jam loquar,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 2, 33</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12791.9" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Cum praes.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto nemo est, quem jam dehinc metuam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 1, 1, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 5</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ut quiescant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne exspectetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juro me L. Tarquinium Superbum ferro, igni, quacunque dehinc vi possim, exsecuturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12791.10" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc dehinc scito, illum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. prol. 125</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12791.11" n="b" level="4"> Referring to a point of time in the past, <hi rend="ital">thenceforwards, since then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex instituto Tiberii omnes dehinc Caesares beneficia ... aliter rata non haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duplex dehinc fama est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 58</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12791.12" n="B" level="2"> Without respect to the term. <hi rend="ital">a quo</hi>, pointing to a future time. </sense><sense id="n12791.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Hereupon, afterwards, next, then</hi> (not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Eurum ad se Zephyrumque vocat, dehinc talia fatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 256</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 722</bibl>; 6, 678; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 104</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehinc audito legionum tumultu raptim profectus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">post-positum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae postquam vates sic ore effatus amico est, Dona dehinc ... imperat ad naves ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de qua dehinc dicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:97" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 19</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12791.14" n="2" level="3"> In enumerations ( = deinde), <hi rend="ital">then</hi> (rare, and, excepting once in Sall., not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">arduum videtur res gestas scribere: primum quod ... dehinc quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so after primum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 167</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">after primo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incipiet putrescere, dehinc laxata ire in humorem ... tunc exsilient flumina, inde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:29" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 29</bibl></cit>.—Cf. Hand, Turs. II. pp. 229-232.</sense></entryFree>
dehisco: <entryFree id="n12792" type="main" key="de^hisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-hisco</orth>, <itype>hīvi</itype> (in the <sense id="n12792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> dehisse, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), ĕre, <hi rend="ital">v. n., to part, divide, go apart; to split open; to gape, to yawn</hi> (excepting once in Varr., not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dehisse terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=148" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 148</bibl></cit> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the yawning earth,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:479" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 479</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 432</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:24 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 24 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda dehiscens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque enim ante dehiscent Attonitae magna ora domus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex intervallo os paulum dehiscit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 29 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymba rimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navigium,</quote> <trans><tr>springs aleak</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehiscens intervallis acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehiscere ingentibus rimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 91</bibl></cit> Fragm. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rosa paullatim rubescens dehiscit ac sese pandit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 4, 10, § 14</bibl></cit>; cf. ib. § 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thynni pinguescunt in tantum ut dehiscant,</quote> <trans><tr>burst open</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dehonestamentum: <entryFree id="n12793" type="main" key="de^ho^nesta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕhŏnestāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dehonesto</etym>, <sense id="n12793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which disfigures</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dishonors; a blemish, deformity, disgrace, dishonor</hi> (excepting once in Sallust, only post-Aug. for dedecus, ignominia). </sense><sense id="n12793.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: corporis, Sall. Hist. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:27:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 27, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">originis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiarum (sc. scurrae, histriones, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12793.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: ignominiae et cetera dehonestamenta, Sen. Const. sap. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dehonestatio: <entryFree id="n12794" type="main" key="de^ho^nesta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕhŏnestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disgrace, dishonor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 18</bibl>. <cb n="DEIC" /></sense></entryFree>
dehonesto: <entryFree id="n12795" type="main" key="de^ho^nesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-hŏnesto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disgrace, disparage, dishonor</hi> (once in Liv., otherwise post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dehonestamentum): famam maculari dehonestarique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">proavum infami opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 70</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 4, 74 al.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:6:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:adv. Marc. 22:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 22, 2</bibl>; Just 7, 3, 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanum imperium, Treb. Gall. 16: amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 25, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dehonestus: <entryFree id="n12796" type="main" key="de^ho^nestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-hŏnestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., unbecoming, improper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dehonoro: <entryFree id="n12797" type="main" key="de^ho^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-hŏnōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to dishonor</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> 3, p. 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dehonorata Babylon,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dehortatio: <entryFree id="n12798" type="hapax" key="de^horta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕhortātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dehortor</etym>, <sense id="n12798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissuading</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dehortativus: <entryFree id="n12799" type="main" key="de^horta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕhortātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fit for dissuading, likely to dissuade</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1020</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 21, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dehortatorius: <entryFree id="n12800" type="main" key="de^horta_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕhortātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissuasive, dehortatory</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dehortor: <entryFree id="n12801" type="main" key="de^hortor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-hortor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n12801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per tmesin</hi> de me hortatur, Enn., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to advise to the contrary; to dissuade</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa me aut invitabit aut dehortabitur, * Cic Pis. 39, 94: multa me dehortantur a vobis,</quote> <trans><tr>dissuade me from espousing your cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 31</bibl></cit>: Hannibal audaci tum pectore de me hortatur, Ne bellum faciam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 195, 21</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">me ne darem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: multa me dehortata sunt huc prodire, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plura de Jugurtha scribere dehortatur me fortuna mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 24, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deianira: <entryFree id="n12802" type="main" key="De_ia^ni_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēïănīra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhi+a/neira</foreign>, <sense id="n12802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Oeneus, sister of Meleager, wife of Hercules, and mother of Hyllus</hi>. She involuntarily caused the death of Hercules, by sending him the garment Nessus had given her, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:9 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 9 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 34 sq" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 34 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:162" default="NO">162</bibl>; Sen. Herc. Oet.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deicida: <entryFree id="n12803" type="main" key="de^i^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Deus-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n12803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">slayer of God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Judaeos (invidia) fecit esse deicidas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Chrysol. Serm. 172</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deicio: <entryFree id="n12804" type="main" key="de_i^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-ĭcĭo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dejicio</orth>, <itype>jēci, jectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>jacio</etym>, <sense id="n12804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast down; to hurl down, precipitate</hi> (very freq., and class.). </sense><sense id="n12804.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12804.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">araneas de foribus et de pariete,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de ponte in Tiberim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:80" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de saxo (Tarpeio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 39</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem saxo Tarpeio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 12, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum servile a cervicibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togam ab umeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 52</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">togam de umero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 9 al.</bibl></cit>; esp. reflex. with <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se de muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se de superiore parte aedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se per munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:26:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 26, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se a praealtis montibus (venti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">librum in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in locum inferiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 44, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem e summo in Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elatam securim in caput (regis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum e campo in cavam hanc viam,</quote> <trans><tr>force to leap down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bustum aut monumentum, aut columnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">statuas veterum hominum (c. c. depellere simulacra deorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumenta regis templaque Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 2, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa aenea in Capitolio (tempestas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes Hermas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turrim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 14, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <trans><tr>to fell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput uno ictu,</quote> <trans><tr>to cut off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 770</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 546</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">libellos,</quote> <trans><tr>to tear down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 6, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 12</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 15</bibl>, antemnis disjectis is the true reading): comam, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 514, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crinibus dejectis,</quote> <trans><tr>loose, dishevelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast into the urn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectam aerea sortem accepit galea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:490 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 490 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dejecta sors esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pernam, glandium,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw into the pot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to purge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:158" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 158</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">casei caprini, qui facillimi deiciantur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>are most easily digested</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. alvum superiorem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to vomit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:156:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 156, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12804.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drive out, dislodge</hi> an enemy from his position: hostes muro turribusque dejecti, Caes. B. <cb n="DEIC" /> G. 7, 28; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nostri dejecti sunt loco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium ex saltu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen Gallorum ex rupe Tarpeia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tot castellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium Claternā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidium loco summe munito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: praesidium (without <case>abl.</case>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 53 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra hostium,</quote> <trans><tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praetorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12804.5" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to drive out, turn out of possession, eject, dispossess</hi> (cf. deduco): <cit><quote lang="la">unde vi prohibitus sis ... unde dejectus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 17, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi ex eo loco ubi vestigium impresserit, deici neminem posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 27, 76</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de possessione imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.6" n="3" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: deici, <hi rend="ital">to be driven out of</hi> one's <hi rend="ital">course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad inferiorem partem insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis tempestate vexata ad Balearīs insulas deicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 34, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 40, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.7" n="4" level="3"> Pregn. (cf.: cado, concĭdo, decĭdo; caedo, concīdo, decīdo, etc.), <hi rend="ital">to fell with a mortal wound, to bring down dead to the ground; to kill, slay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">his dejectis et coacervatis cadaveribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 51</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem telo primum, quem postremum aspera virgo Deicis?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:665" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 665</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avem ab alto caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 542</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 580</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Glaucoque bovem Thetidique juvencam Deicit Ancaeus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>slaughters as a sacrifice</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:191" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super juvencum stabat dejectum leo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Hercules) aves sagittis dejecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gruem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:580" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 580</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To lower, let down, hang down, depress</hi>, of the head, etc. (cf. II. A. infra): <cit><quote lang="la">dejecto capite (opp. supino capite),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:69" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 69</bibl></cit>.—Of a nod (opp. relato capite), Apul. Met. 10.—Of a wild beast: <cit><quote lang="la">id (caput) dejectum semper in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 32, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pectora mentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">euntes dejecta cervice Getae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> VI. Cons. Hon. 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12804.10" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri Sisennae oculos de isto numquam deicere,</quote> <trans><tr>never took their eyes off him</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos a republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejecit vultum et demissa voce locuta est,</quote> <trans><tr>cast down her eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 320</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9 al.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in Gr. construction, dejectus oculos,</quote> <trans><tr>with downcast eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectus vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:367" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecquid ergo intellegis quantum mali de humana condicione dejeceris?</quote> <trans><tr>thou hast removed, averted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum de doloris terrore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitia a se ratione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cruciatum a corpore (with depellere omnia verbera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc metum Siciliae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 49</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae replenda vel deicienda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum de sententia dejecistis,</quote> <trans><tr>hast diverted from his opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 9, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortis et constantis est, non tumultuantem de gradu deici, ut dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:23:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 23, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 15, 3</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12804.11" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to cast one down from the prospect of</hi> a thing; <hi rend="ital">to prevent from obtaining, to deprive, rob of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de honore deici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de possessione imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 22, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, ad deiciendum honore eum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 41</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, dejecti honore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>; so with simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem aedilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 8, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 8, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 36, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">certo consulatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:28:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinione trium legionum (i. e. spe trium legionum colligendarum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjuge tanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 317</bibl></cit>. —Without <case>abl.</case>: M. Caelium mentio illa fatua ... subito dejecit, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inimicum eo quoque anno petentem dejecisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxorem (sc. conjugio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dejecto,</quote> <trans><tr>after his fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 3, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto dejectus culmine regni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:143" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 143</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12804.12" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To humble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deicimur, sed non perimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deiciendi hominis causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dejectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n12804.13" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sunk down, low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatus noster etsi dejectis atque inferioribus locis constiterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12804.14" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B., <hi rend="ital">deprived of hope;</hi> hence) <hi rend="ital">Cast down, dejected, dispirited</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dejectus equum duci jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:858" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 858</bibl></cit>; cf.: <pb n="535" /> <cb n="DEIN" /> haud sic dejecta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:315" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 315</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in epilogis plerumque dejecti et infracti sumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9</bibl></cit>. 4, 138.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur.— * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">low;</hi> only <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, dejectius, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
deico: <entryFree id="n12805" type="main" key="deico"><orth extent="full" lang="la">deico</orth>, v. 2. dīco.</entryFree>
deidamia: <entryFree id="n12806" type="main" key="De_ida^mi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēïdămīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhi+da/meia</foreign>. <sense id="n12806.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of Lycomedes, king of Scyros, and mother of Pyrrhus by Achilles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:704" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 704</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 682</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12806.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Daughter of King Aeacides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:6:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deiferus: <entryFree id="n12807" type="main" key="de^i^fe^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭ-fĕrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., bearing a god in one's self</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
deifico: <entryFree id="n12808" type="main" key="de^i^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭ-fĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make one a god, to deify</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Civ. D. 19, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deificus: <entryFree id="n12809" type="main" key="de^i^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n12809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">who makes one a god, deifies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12809.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Consecrated, sacred</hi>, lues ( = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h( i(era\ no/sos</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">epilepsy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:30:162" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 30, 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dein: <entryFree id="n12810" type="main" key="dein"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dein</orth>, v. deinde.</entryFree>
deinceps: <entryFree id="n12811" type="main" key="de^inceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕin-ceps</orth> (dissyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 80</bibl>; but trisyl. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 7, 136</bibl>. Cf. dehinc and deinde), <pos>adj.</pos> and <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>capio. Prop., taking place next or after, v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, 591; cf.: particeps, princeps</etym>. <sense id="n12811.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (<hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> deincipis or deincipitis), <hi rend="ital">following thereafter, next following</hi>: deinceps qui deinde cepit, ut princeps qui primum cepit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 2</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deincipem antiqui dicebant proxime quemque captum ut principem primum captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:75:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 75, 4</bibl></cit>. So only: deincipiti die, Ap. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 16, p. 353, 33.—</sense><sense id="n12811.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv., in a constant series, one after another, successively, in turn</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(ch=s</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">e)fech=s</foreign> (for syn. cf.: deinde, exinde, inde, indidem, post, postea, porro—freq. and good prose). </sense><sense id="n12811.2" n="A" level="2"> In space: <cit><quote lang="la">arboribus deinceps constitutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">his (saxis) collocatis et coagmentatis alius insuper ordo adicitur, etc.... sic deinceps omne opus contexitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25, 8</bibl>: ea quae <foreign lang="greek">a)krostixi/s</foreign> dicitur, cum deinceps ex primis versuum litteris aliquid conectitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 54, 111</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:47:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 47, 183</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima ... ac deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 19, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12811.3" n="B" level="2"> In time: <cit><quote lang="la">duo deinceps reges civitatem auxerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut deinceps qui accubarent canerent ad tibiam clarorum virorum laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trīs fratres, quos video deinceps tribunos plebis per triennium fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clamore significant, hunc alii deinceps excipiunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.—Esp. freq. with <hi rend="ital">alii, reliqui, multi, omnes, totus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes dispositas haberent atque alios alii deinceps exciperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">receperunt Arverni eum deincepsque aliae gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:14" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 14</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquis deinceps diebus Caesar silvas caedere instituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 40, 4</bibl>; 7, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">possum deinceps totam rem explicare, deinde ad extremum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12811.4" n="C" level="2"> In order. </sense><sense id="n12811.5" n="(a)" level="5"> With ordinals (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">septimus sum deinceps praetorius in gente nostra,</quote> <trans><tr>the seventh in succession</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12811.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In denoting the successive parts of a discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">de justitia satis dictum est: deinceps, ut erat propositum, de beneficentia ac de liberalitate dicatur, i. e. ordine sic ferente,</quote> <trans><tr>successively, in order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 14, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 52</bibl>; 3, 2, 7.—</sense><sense id="n12811.7" n="(g)" level="5"> To indicate an immediate sequence: <cit><quote lang="la">si non ab eo, in quo proxime desitum, deinceps incipietur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:20:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 20, 28</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annales Ennii ut deinceps legi possint,</quote> <trans><tr>that they may be read on continuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 9, 14</bibl>. In this use deinceps is often very nearly = deinde, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31, 1 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n12811.8" n="2" level="3"> In particular combinations. </sense><sense id="n12811.9" n="a" level="4"> Deinde deinceps, inde deinceps, postea deinceps, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/peita e(ch=s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde etiam deinceps posteris prodebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps inde multae, quas non minus diligenter elaboratas ... afferebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:90:312" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90, 312</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps inde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequitate sua postea trium regum bellis deinceps omnibus functum officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12811.10" n="b" level="4"> Corresp. with primus: primum est <cb n="DEIN" /> officium, ut se conservet in naturae statu: <cit><quote lang="la">deinceps, ut ea teneat, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 6, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">principes sint patria et parentes ... proximi liberi totaque domus ... deinceps bene convenientes propinqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 58</bibl></cit>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 48</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12811.11" n="c" level="4"> Hence, after enumerations, in phrases like Eng. <hi rend="ital">and so forth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut prima (officia) diis immortalibus, secunda patriae, tertia parentibus, deinceps gradatim reliqua reliquis debeantur,</quote> <trans><tr>and so on</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:45:160" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 45, 160</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nam et in prooemio primum est aliquid et secundum ac deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">et deinceps, ac deinceps,</quote> <trans><tr>and so forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:12:6 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 12, 6 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12811.12" n="d" level="4"> Perge deinceps, <hi rend="ital">go on</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae villaticae sunt, quas deinceps rure habent in villis,</quote> <trans><tr>continually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 232-238.</sense></entryFree>
deinde: <entryFree id="n12812" type="main" key="de^inde^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕindĕ</orth>, and abbrev. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dein</orth> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1008</bibl> P., and <sense id="n12812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">exin, proin</hi>—in both forms <hi rend="ital">ei</hi> is monosyl. in the class. poets; <cit><quote lang="la">as dissyl.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ditt. 1, 1</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>de-inde</etym>, <hi rend="ital">thereafter, thereupon</hi> (for syn. cf.: dein, exinde, inde, deinceps, post, postea, porro).—</sense><sense id="n12812.1" n="I" level="1"> In place (rare), <hi rend="ital">from there, from that place</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">via interest perangusta, deinde paulo latior patescit campus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12812.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in (local) succession, <hi rend="ital">thereafter, next</hi> (cf. dehinc, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">auxiliares Galli Germanique in fronte, post quos pedites sagittarii, dein quatuor legiones, exin totidem aliae legiones, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>next</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juxta Hermanduros Narisci, ac deinde Marcomanni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec quidem duo binis pedibus incisim: dein membratim, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:213" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 213</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Baliares locat ante signa ... dein graviorem armis peditem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12812.3" n="II" level="1"> In time. </sense><sense id="n12812.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Thereafter, afterwards, then</hi> (common in all periods and styles): <cit><quote lang="la">hostes contra legiones suas instruunt. Deinde utrique imperatores in medium exeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accepit conditionem, dein quaestum occipit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 1, 1, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">complures ex iis occiderunt: deinde se in castra receperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dein Tubero, Nescio (inquit) Africane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: incipe, Damoeta; <cit><quote lang="la">tu deinde sequēre, Menalca. Alternis dicetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 58</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">unguibus et pugnis, dein fustibus, atque ita porro Pugnabant armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Aequis nihil deinde memorabile actum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12812.5" n="b" level="4"> Freq. after <hi rend="ital">primum, principio, prius, inde, postea, postremo</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar primum suo, deinde omnium ex conspectu remotis equis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 20</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 108</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">principio duplicavit illum pristinum patrum numerum, deinde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs montem sacrum prius, deinde Aventinum occupavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc secutus est Cursor. deinde L. Maso aedilicius: inde multi Masones ...: deinde Carbones et Turdi insequuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 21 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubent venire agros Attalensium ...: deinde agros in Macedonia regios ...: deinde agrum optimum et fructuosissimum Corinthium ...: post autem agros in Hispania ... tum vero ipsam veterem Carthaginem vendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe oppidana lascivia invicem incessente probra, deinde saxa, postremo ferrum sumpsere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corresp. with in praesentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 26</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12812.6" n="c" level="4"> Connected with <hi rend="ital">tum, tunc, postea, porro, postremo</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">primum ea quae sumus acturi cogitare debemus, deinde tum dicere ac facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=42" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 42</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deinde tum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde tunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:23" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:109" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 109</bibl></cit>: servos Milonis sibi confessos esse de interficiendo Cn. Pompeio conjurasse; <cit><quote lang="la">deinde postea se gladio percussum esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 24, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deinde postea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 1, 2</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postea deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi> 5; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also deinde eam postea supprimat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 26, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post deinde,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:23:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde porro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epid. 5, 2, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mox deinde,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ad extremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:10:section=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 10, § 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde deinceps,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:30:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 30, 64</bibl></cit> (dub.); id, Leg. 3, 2, 4; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12812.7" n="d" level="4"> Strengthened by <hi rend="ital">cum, postquam,<cb n="DEJE" />  posteaquam, ubi</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">dein (deinde) cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 12, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde cum,</quote> <trans><tr>as soon as</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dein cum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 51, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde (dein) postquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 37</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde posteaquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde (dein) ubi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 68:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 68, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12812.8" n="B" level="2"> Of future time, <hi rend="ital">hereafter, from this time forward</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">tu velim cures ut sciam, quibus nos dare oporteat eas, quas ad te deinde litteras mittemus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> ad Q. Frat. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 280</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">experiamini quidquid deinde fors tulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:25:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 25, 17</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12812.9" n="III" level="1"> In an enumeration or succession of facts or arguments, <hi rend="ital">afterwards, next in order, then</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a prima congressione maris et feminae, deinde a progenie et cognatione ordiar, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 24, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te ad coenas itare desisse moleste fero ... Deinde etiam vereor ... ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:11:45 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 11, 45 sq.</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12812.10" n="B" level="2"> Esp. freq. following <hi rend="ital">primum</hi> (primus), followed by <hi rend="ital">postremo</hi> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod in homine multo est evidentius, primum ex ea caritate, quae, etc., deinde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 65</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 17</bibl> et passim; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">deinde, several times repeated,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:54:108 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 54, 108 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primum with deinde eight times, and finally postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ... tum ... post, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ... deinde ... postremo ...,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16, 49</bibl></cit>: excellente tum Crasso et Antonio, deinde (<hi rend="ital">next in the order of excellence</hi>, not of time) Philippo, post Julio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:88:301" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 88, 301</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deinde ... tum ... postremo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:6 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 9, 6 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima nobilitas Cilicio ... dein Lyciae Olympo, mox Centuripino, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so after optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 87, § 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:119" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 9, 38, § 119</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">after laudatissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 18, 69, § 115</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 21, 92, § 160</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">femur promovetur saepissime in interiorem: deinde in exteriorem: raro admodum in priorem aut posteriorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12812.11" n="C" level="2"> So, in a climax, emphasizing the last of a series: <cit><quote lang="la">suis artibus, fraude, deinde insidiis est prope circumventus,</quote> <trans><tr>at length, in fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 41</bibl>; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 238 -249.</sense></entryFree>
deinsuper: <entryFree id="n12813" type="hapax" key="de^insu^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕin-sŭper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, = desuper, <sense id="n12813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from above</hi>: in murum attollitur, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 530 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
deintegro: <entryFree id="n12814" type="hapax" key="de^inte_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-intē^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to impair, destroy</hi>: nomen virginis (i. e. virginitatem) deintegravit, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deintus: <entryFree id="n12815" type="main" key="de^intus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-intus</orth>, <sense id="n12815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., from within</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a parte interiore (late Lat.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 4, p. 353</bibl></cit> Bip.; <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. de foris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:11:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 11, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 11, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deionides: <entryFree id="n12816" type="main" key="De_i_o^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhi+oni/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n12816.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Deïone by Apollo</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Miletus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 442</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deiopea: <entryFree id="n12817" type="main" key="De_i^o^pe_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēĭŏpēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhi+opei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n12817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Juno's nymphs</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 343</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deiotarus: <entryFree id="n12818" type="main" key="De_io^ta^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēiŏtărus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n12818.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tetrarch of Galatia, afterwards king in Armenia Minor and a part of Pontus;</hi> a contemporary of Pompey and Caesar, and of Cicero, who made on his behalf a well-known oration, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 21, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12818.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the preceding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:31 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 31 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
deipara: <entryFree id="n12819" type="main" key="de^i^pa^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭpăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deus-pario</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">*qeoto/kos</foreign>, <sense id="n12819.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who gives birth to God</hi>, of the Virgin Mary, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deipassianus: <entryFree id="n12820" type="main" key="De^i_passia_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĕīpassiānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deus-patior</etym>, <sense id="n12820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a believer in the capacity of the Divine nature for suffering</hi>, Marcellin. Com. Chron. An. 512.</sense></entryFree>
deiphobe: <entryFree id="n12821" type="main" key="De_i^pho^be_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēĭphŏbē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Glaucus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 36</bibl>; cf. Serv. in h. l.</sense></entryFree>
deiphobus: <entryFree id="n12822" type="main" key="De_i^pho^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēĭphŏbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhi+/fobos</foreign>, <sense id="n12822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Priam and Hecuba, and husband of Helen after the death of Paris</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 310</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 495</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 547</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl>(4), 1, 29.</sense></entryFree>
deitas: <entryFree id="n12823" type="main" key="de^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deus</etym>, <sense id="n12823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the divine nature, deity;</hi> late Latin for divinitas, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qeo/ths</foreign>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 144 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dejecte: <entryFree id="n12824" type="main" key="de_jecte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectē</orth>, <sense id="n12824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., low</hi>, v. deicio, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dejectio: <entryFree id="n12825" type="main" key="de_jecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deicio</etym>, <sense id="n12825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a throwing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casting down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">out</hi> (rare). </sense><sense id="n12825.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (acc. to deicio <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1 A. and B.): <cit><quote lang="la">imaginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. Const. 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12825.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n12825.3" n="A" level="2"> <pb n="536" /> <cb n="DELA" /> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvi,</quote> <trans><tr>a purging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejectio alone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 120:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 120, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12825.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., legal t. t., <hi rend="ital">ejection, a turning out of possession</hi>: qui illam vim dejectionemque fecerit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 20, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:16:1:section=34" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 16, 1, § 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12825.5" n="C" level="2"> (Acc. to dejectus, <hi rend="ital">P. a. no.</hi> I.) Altitudines stellarum et dejectiones, <hi rend="ital">depressions</hi>, Firmic. Math. 2, 3.—</sense><sense id="n12825.6" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradūs dejectio,</quote> <trans><tr>degradation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi nostri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Mac. 3, 43.—（<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:59:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 59, 11</bibl>, defectione is prob. the true reading.)</sense></entryFree>
dejectiuncula: <entryFree id="n12826" type="hapax" key="de_jecti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dejectio <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight purging</hi>, Scribon. Comp. 52.</sense></entryFree>
dejecto: <entryFree id="n12827" type="hapax" key="de_jecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12827.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [deicio], <hi rend="ital">to hurl down</hi>: vasa cuncta, Mattius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dejector: <entryFree id="n12828" type="main" key="de_jector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12828.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who throws</hi> or <hi rend="ital">casts down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:3:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 3, 5, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dejectus: <entryFree id="n12829" type="main" key="de_jectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from deicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12830" type="main" key="de_jectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deicio</etym>, <sense id="n12830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a casting</hi> or <hi rend="ital">throwing down</hi> (rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n12830.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis (Penei),</quote> <trans><tr>fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 571</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fluminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 56</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 4, 21, § 75</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12830.2" n="B" level="2"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is thrown over, a covering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velatum geminae dejectu lyncis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:272" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 272</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12830.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp., of localities (acc. to <itype>dejectus</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, I.), <hi rend="ital">a declivity, descent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dejectu positus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 70, 71, § 179</bibl></cit>. In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis ex utraque parte lateris dejectūs habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12830.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lowering</hi> of the voice, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qe/sis</foreign> (opp. elatio, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/rsis</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Fulg. Myth. 3:9, p. 129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Fulg. Myth. 3, 9, p. 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dejeratio: <entryFree id="n12831" type="main" key="de_je^ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējĕrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. dejuratio.</entryFree>
dejero: <entryFree id="n12832" type="main" key="de_je^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (the later form <orth extent="full" lang="la">de-jūro</orth>, found in many edd., is now retained only in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:20" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:6:1" default="NO">11, 6, 1</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>dejuro, with shortened rad. vowel; cf. Corss.
