Ausspr. 2, 203</etym>, <sense id="n12832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take an oath, to swear</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">per omnes deos et deas dejeravit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 6</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille dejerasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 9</bibl></cit> al; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 20, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eccl. 9, 2</bibl>. (In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 3, 42, the true reading is pejerat.)</sense></entryFree>
dejicio: <entryFree id="n12833" type="main" key="de_ji^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jĭcĭo</orth>, v. de-icio.</entryFree>
dejugis: <entryFree id="n12834" type="hapax" key="de_ju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jŭgis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>jugum</etym>, <sense id="n12834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sloping</hi>, = declivis: <cit><quote lang="la">dejuge dorso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 164</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dejugo: <entryFree id="n12835" type="hapax" key="de_ju^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jŭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (lit., to remove from the yoke; hence transf.), <sense id="n12835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to separate, sever</hi>: nostram unanimitatem quam memoria dejugat, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 27</bibl>, and 142, 32 (Trag. v. 110 Rib.); cf. abjugo and adjugo.</sense></entryFree>
dejungo: <entryFree id="n12836" type="main" key="de_jungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jungo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unyoke</hi> cattle: IVNCTO DEIVNCTOVE IVMENTO, Inscr. ap. Grut. 1003, 2.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>, dejunctum, dub. reading for dijunctum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 10:3:section=45" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 10, 3, § 45</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dejuratio: <entryFree id="n12837" type="main" key="de_ju_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējūrātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dējĕr-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dejuro</etym>, <sense id="n12837.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oath</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">testari sub dejuratione (al. dejeratione),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Poenit. 4</bibl></cit>: DEIERATIO ESTO APVD MAGISTRATOS, Inscr. Fratr. Arv. ap. Marin. p. 70.</sense></entryFree>
dejurium: <entryFree id="n12838" type="hapax" key="de_ju_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dējūrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n12838.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dejurio vincti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:18:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 18, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dejuro: <entryFree id="n12839" type="main" key="de_ju_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jūro</orth>, v. dejero.</entryFree>
dejuvo: <entryFree id="n12840" type="hapax" key="de_ju^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-jŭvo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to leave off helping, to withhold assistance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere illum et dejuvare in rebus advorsis pudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delabor: <entryFree id="n12841" type="main" key="de_la_bor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lābor</orth>, <itype>lapsus, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to fall, sink, slip down</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12841.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum, de caelo delapsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de manibus audacissimorum civium delapsa arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:22:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 22, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus ab humero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:144" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex utraque parte (aqua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: ab aethere, <hi rend="ital">to glide down</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">to fly down</hi>, sc. to the earth, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 608</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aetheriis ab astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 838</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 722</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo Olympo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 101</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquila leniter delapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curru delapsus eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:596" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 596</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 685</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">serta capiti delapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram delabi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:838" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 838</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in scrobes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de caelo in provinciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DELA" /> 1, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare (flumen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 29, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit medios delapsus in hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 377</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te aequoream Lemnon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:127" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce delapsa a magnifica gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 2</bibl></cit> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12841.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (esp. freq. in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">to come down, sink, descend;</hi> and with reference to the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to slide</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall into</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam a sapientium familiaritatibus ad vulgares amicitias oratio nostra delabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:6:section=18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 6, § 18</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">aut a minoribus ad majora ascendimus, aut a majoribus ad minora delabimur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in idem genus morbi delapsa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc vitium scurrile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amorem libertae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ambitionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus in similitudinem proclivi cursu delabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in istum sermonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eas difficultates, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 17</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 18, 59 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aequitatem et ad rerum naturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad impatientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad inopiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 38</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of sounds, <hi rend="ital">to descend, be derived</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">atque etiam illa sunt ab his delapsa plura genera (vocum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl></cit>.—In epistolary style: eo magis delabor ad Clodiam, <hi rend="ital">I incline to Clodia</hi> (i. e. to purchase her gardens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 47, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delaboro: <entryFree id="n12842" type="hapax" key="de_la^bo_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lăbōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to work hard, to overwork</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delacero: <entryFree id="n12843" type="main" key="de_la^ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lăcĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (lit., <sense id="n12843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tear in pieces</hi>), trop., <hi rend="ital">to frustrate, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me meamque rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit> Brix. (Fleck., dilaceravisti, v. dilacero).</sense></entryFree>
delacrimatio: <entryFree id="n12844" type="main" key="de_la_^cri^ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlā^crĭmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>delacrimo</etym>, <sense id="n12844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a watery running</hi> or <hi rend="ital">weeping of the eyes</hi> (as a disease), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 99, § 156</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> 34, 11, 26, § 113.—</sense><sense id="n12844.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cessation of weeping</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delacrimatorius: <entryFree id="n12845" type="hapax" key="de_la_^cri^ma_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlā^crĭmātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">for</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to weeping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delacrimo: <entryFree id="n12846" type="hapax" key="de_la_^cri^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lā^crĭmo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">lacrumo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to shed tears, to weep;</hi> transf., of the vine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
delaevo: <entryFree id="n12847" type="main" key="de_laevo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlaevo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. dēlēvo.</entryFree>
delambo: <entryFree id="n12848" type="hapax" key="de_lambo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lambo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lick off, to lick</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:681" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 681</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delamentor: <entryFree id="n12849" type="hapax" key="de_la_mentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lāmentor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to lament, bewail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natam ademptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 331</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delaniare: <entryFree id="n12850" type="gloss" key="de_la^ni^a_re"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlănĭāre</orth> <itype>est descindere et quasi lanam trahere</itype>, unde <sense id="n12850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lacinia</hi> et <hi rend="ital">lanius</hi> dicitur, qui pecus discindit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
delapido: <entryFree id="n12851" type="main" key="de_la^pi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlăpĭdo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n12851.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To clear from stones</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:46:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 46, 1</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12851.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lay with stones, to pave</hi>: DELAPIDATA lapide strata, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 13</bibl> Müll.; cf.: DELAPIDATA, <foreign lang="greek">liqo/strwta</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
delapsus: <entryFree id="n12852" type="main" key="de_lapsus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlapsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from delabor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12853" type="hapax" key="de_lapsus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlapsus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>delabor</etym>, <sense id="n12853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a falling off, descent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>a flowing off, discharge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
delassabilis: <entryFree id="n12854" type="hapax" key="de_lassa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlassābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delasso</etym>, <sense id="n12854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be wearied out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 242</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delasso: <entryFree id="n12855" type="main" key="de_lasso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lasso</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to weary</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tire out</hi> (rare and <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for defetigare): <cit><quote lang="la">labore delassatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loquacem Fabium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with a thing as obj.: <cit><quote lang="la">delasset omnes fabulas poetarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
delatio: <entryFree id="n12856" type="main" key="de_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defero, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2. b.</etym>, <sense id="n12856.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accusation, denunciation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:20:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 20, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cluent. 8, 25</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuicumque vos delationem dedissetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 15, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 13</bibl>; in <hi rend="ital">plural</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 2</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
delator: <entryFree id="n12857" type="main" key="de_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accuser, informer, denouncer</hi> (only post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Tacit. and Suet.): judices ... delatores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:74" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">3, 10, 3: delatorum judicium, quasi latronum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:34:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 34, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of hightreason</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 50</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Papiae legis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>one who denounces a violation of it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delatorius: <entryFree id="n12858" type="main" key="de_la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delator</etym>, <sense id="n12858.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to an informer</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">curiositas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:2:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli,</quote> <trans><tr>denunciatory writings</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 10, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delatura: <entryFree id="n12859" type="main" key="de_la_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>defero, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B. 2. b.</etym> (late Lat. for delatio), <sense id="n12859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an accusation, information</hi>,<cb n="DELE" />  <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; Vulg Sirach, 38, 17.</sense></entryFree>
delavo: <entryFree id="n12860" type="main" key="de_la^vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lăvo</orth>, no <sense id="n12860.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, -lōtum, āre, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to wash off, wash clean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porcellum liquamine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:8" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 8</bibl></cit>. 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delebilis: <entryFree id="n12861" type="hapax" key="de_le_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deleo</etym>, <sense id="n12861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be blotted out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:84:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 84, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delectabilis: <entryFree id="n12862" type="main" key="de_lecta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delecto</etym>, <sense id="n12862.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delectable, delightful, agreeable</hi> (post-Aug. for jucundus, amoenus): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apologi (with festivi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 7, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: tibia questu, App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 17.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">delec-tabiliter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">delightfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac decore depicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et feliciter declamare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 15, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectabilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Don. Persev. 53" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Don. Persev. 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delectamentum: <entryFree id="n12863" type="main" key="de_lecta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delight</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">pro delectamento,</quote> <trans><tr>amusement, pastime</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectamenta puerorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:25:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 25, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Paneg. Const. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delectatio: <entryFree id="n12864" type="main" key="de_lecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delighting, delight, pleasure, amusement</hi> (freq. and good prose): <hi rend="ital">delectatio</hi> voluptas suavitate auditus animum deleniens, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo videndi et audiendi delectatione ducitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">conviviorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 45</bibl></cit>. More freq. without <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira quaedam in cognoscendo suavitas et delectatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:43:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 43, 193</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jucunditas delectatioque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38, 155</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(doctrina et literae), quae secundis rebus delectationem modo habere, videbantur, nunc vero etiam salutem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiam et delectationem afferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:9" default="NO">9, 4, 9</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in amicitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 8, 18</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">plural</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:39 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 19, 39 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12864.1" n="II" level="1"> As medic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a straining, effort, tenesmus</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">frequens ventris egerendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:6:88" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 6, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:3:46" default="NO">4, 3, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delectatiuncula: <entryFree id="n12865" type="main" key="de_lecta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>delectatio</etym>, <sense id="n12865.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trifling pleasure, petty delight</hi>, Gell. praef. § 23.</sense></entryFree>
delectio: <entryFree id="n12866" type="hapax" key="de_lecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deligo</etym> (post-class. for delectus), <sense id="n12866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choosing, choice</hi>: imperatoris, Vopisc. Aurel. 40.</sense></entryFree>
delecto: <entryFree id="n12867" type="main" key="de_lecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlecto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [delicio]. </sense><sense id="n12867.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To allure from the right path, to entice away, to seduce</hi> (only ante-class.): me Apollo ipse delectat, ductat Delphicus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 32</bibl> (Trag. v. 390 Vahl.: delectare, illicere, attrahere, Non.): hostem, Quadrig. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 98, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi sementem facturus eris, ibi oves delectato,</quote> <trans><tr>keep back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:30" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 30</bibl></cit> (also copied in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 9, 6, § 55</bibl>). —</sense><sense id="n12867.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (effectus pro causa), <hi rend="ital">to delight</hi>, sc. by attracting, alluring; <hi rend="ital">to please, charm, amuse</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: oblecto, juvo): mentem atque animum delectat suum, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pamphilam arcesse, ut delectet hic nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tam ista me sapientiae fama delectat, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive Falernum to magis delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 17 al.</bibl></cit>—With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectari multis inanibus rebus, ut honore, ut gloria, etc.: animo autem virtute praedito ... non admodum delectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminibus inferendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carminibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 1, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">iambis (with gaudere carmine),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 59</bibl></cit> et passim: <cit><quote lang="la">interea cum Musis nos delectabimus aequo animo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Musis delectari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:27" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 27</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut me ab eo delectari facilius quam decipi putem posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:195" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 195</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc admodum delector, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:7:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit> Goer.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille me delectat in omni genere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alio sua quemque natura delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:45:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 45, 1</bibl></cit>.—In ellipt. style, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me magis de Dionysio delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> as subject: <cit><quote lang="la">quam delectabat eum defectiones solis et lunae multo ante nobis praedicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 14, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:26:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 26, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare casas ... si quem delectet barbatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 249</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me pedibus delectat claudere verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectat Veneris decerpere flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 103</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: vir bonus et <pb n="537" /> <cb n="DELE" /> prudens dici delector, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 3, 9</bibl>: delectat, <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> (late Lat.), Boeth. Cons. Phil. 2, 3.</sense></entryFree>
delector: <entryFree id="n12868" type="main" key="de_lector1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlector</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>collat. form of preceding</etym>, <sense id="n12868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to delight, charm</hi> (only in the foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">cum dominam suam delectaretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">64, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12869" type="hapax" key="de_lector2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deligo</etym>, <sense id="n12869.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who draws out, levies, recruits</hi>, Frontin. Strat. 4, 1, 3.</sense></entryFree>
delectus: <entryFree id="n12870" type="main" key="de_lectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. deligo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12871" type="main" key="de_lectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlectus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīlectus</orth> (so often in best MSS., and adopted by Halm in Quint. and Cic., Weissenb. in Liv., Dietsch in Sall., and by Brambach, etc.; but Bait. and Kay. in Cic., Dinter and Nipperdey in Caes., delectus), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. deligo</etym>, <sense id="n12871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a choosing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">picking out, a selecting; a selection, choice, distinction</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n12871.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">utrimque tibi nunc dilectum para,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi quidem etiam lautius videtur, quod eligitur, et ad quod delectus adhibetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:30:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 30, 90</bibl></cit>: earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut, etc. (shortly before: cum soluta nobis est <hi rend="ital">eligendi</hi> optio), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc verborum genere propriorum delectus est quidam habendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:37:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 37, 150</bibl></cit>; so, verborum, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:72:253" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 72, 253</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 6</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum verborumque agendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbis delectum adhibere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>: cujus (<foreign lang="greek">eu)fwni/as</foreign>) in eo dilectus est, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum delectum atque discrimen pecunia sustulisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:25:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 25, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus hominum et dignitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 14, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptorum beneficiorum sunt delectus habendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non delectu aliquo aut sapientia ducitur ad judicandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine ullo delectu, sine populi Rom. notione, sine judicio senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 325</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and on the contrary, cum delectu,</quote> <trans><tr>making a selection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:13:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 13, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12871.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a levy, a recruiting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per legatos delectum habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 1</bibl></cit>; so, delectum habere, a standing phrase for <hi rend="ital">recruiting</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the postAug. agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 29, 30, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas (legiones) ex novo delectu confecerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus superbissimo delectu collectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincialis,</quote> <trans><tr>made in the province, provincial</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12871.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concreto), <hi rend="ital">the men levied, a levy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e Britannico delectu octo milia sibi adjunxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delegatio: <entryFree id="n12872" type="main" key="de_le_ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>delego, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n12872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an assignment, substitution, delegation</hi> of one person by another. </sense><sense id="n12872.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">a mancipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of one thing for another: delegatione perfecta solutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. context.—</sense><sense id="n12872.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">necesse est ipse laborem impendas: delegationem res ista non recipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 27:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 27, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delegator: <entryFree id="n12873" type="hapax" key="de_le_ga_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēgātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12873.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes an assignment</hi> (sc. to another person), <hi rend="ital">an assignor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delegatorius: <entryFree id="n12874" type="hapax" key="de_le_ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to an assignment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 7, 4, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delego: <entryFree id="n12875" type="main" key="de_le_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lēgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to send, assign, dispatch, delegate</hi> a person to any place, person or business; <hi rend="ital">to assign, confide, commit, intrust</hi> any thing to a person (for attention, care, protection, etc.); <hi rend="ital">to charge</hi> a person with a business; <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">impose upon</hi> a person any <hi rend="ital">charge, order, business, command</hi>, etc., esp. of that which one prefers not to attend to in person (good prose; not in Caes.; perh. not in Cic.; v. the doubtful passage <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 5, 2</bibl>, and Orell. ad loc.). </sense><sense id="n12875.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n12875.2" n="A" level="2"> With personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">si cui fautores delegatos viderint, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 67</bibl></cit> and 83: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in Tullianum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infantem ancillis ac nutricibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassium Longinum occidendum delegaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiosos Catonis ad illud volumen delegamus,</quote> <trans><tr>refer to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad senatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit> <cb n="DELE" /> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n12875.3" n="B" level="2"> With a thing as object: hunc laborem alteri delegavi, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">curam nepotum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">2: officium alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: ministerium triumviris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictionem magistratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinandas bibliothecas alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gramm. 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidione delegata in curam collegae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delegato sibi officio functi sunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12875.4" n="II" level="1"> In partic., t. t. in the lang. of business, <hi rend="ital">to assign, transfer, make over</hi>, either one who is to pay a debt or the debt itself: <hi rend="ital">delegare</hi> est vice sua alium reum dare creditori, vel cui jusserit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:2:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 46, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitores nobis deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">delegabo te ad Epicurum, ab illo fiet numeratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 18, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen paterni debitoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:6:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quinto delegabo, si quid aeri meo alieno superabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Balbi regia condicio est delegandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to assign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:11:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 11, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12875.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to attribute, impute, ascribe to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc crimen optimis nominibus delegare possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">causam peccati mortuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:22:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelera ipsa aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne rei bene aut secus gestae in Etruria decus dedecusque ad Volumnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">servati consulis decus ad servum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
delenificus: <entryFree id="n12876" type="main" key="de_le_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēnĭfĭcus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">delin-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delenio-facio</etym>, <sense id="n12876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soothing, caressing, captivating, flattering, enchanting</hi> (ante- and postclass.): verba, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 567, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 39</bibl></cit>: ingenium mulierum, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 278, 2</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Ver. 1 al" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Ver. 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
delenimentum: <entryFree id="n12877" type="main" key="de_le_ni_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēnīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">delin-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>delenio</etym>, <sense id="n12877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">any thing that soothes, charms</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">allures, a charm, blandishment, allurement, enticement</hi> (ante - class., and repeatedly since the Aug. period, but not in Cic. or Caes.), Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 4</bibl>, and 8 (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 77 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
delenio: <entryFree id="n12878" type="main" key="de_le_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lēnĭo</orth>, and in many MSS. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīnĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi, ītum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n12878.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to soothe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">soften down, to cajole, charm, win, captivate, entice</hi> (very freq., and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">delenitus sum profecto ita, ut me qui sim nesciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 214</bibl></cit>: dotibus deleniti, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 72, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mulierem non nuptialibus donis sed filiorum funeribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites blande appellando (with allicere oratione benigna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:14:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 14, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem blanditiis voluptatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum disertorum oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirenum cantu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Midan barbarico carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 163</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animos hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 38</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, animos popularium praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum adulescentis pellexit iis omnibus rebus, quibus illa aetas capi ac deleniri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolentem nec Phrygius lapis delenit, etc. ( = permulcet),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tristemque delinivit blanditiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 34, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:24:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Par. 24, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delenitor: <entryFree id="n12879" type="hapax" key="de_le_ni_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēnītor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">delin-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>delenio</etym>, <sense id="n12879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who softens down, soothes, wins over</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 246</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delenitorius: <entryFree id="n12880" type="main" key="de_le_ni_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlēnītōrĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">delin.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12880.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., pertaining to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serving for softening, soothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 10, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deleo: <entryFree id="n12881" type="main" key="de_le^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĕo</orth>, <itype>lēvi, lētum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n12881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> delerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Red. in Sen. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:19:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 19, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">plqpf. subj. sync.</hi> delesset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 40, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> dēlĭtus: litterae delitae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 372</bibl>: epistola delita, Calvus ib.; Cic. Ep. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 873</bibl>; cf. 1. aboleo), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. R. lī, adhere; cf.: vi-lī, dissolve; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">li/mnh, limh/n, leimw/n</foreign>, etc.; Lat. lino, <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> levi; polio, etc.; cf. also Gr. <foreign lang="greek">limo/s</foreign>, Lat. lētum</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to abolish, destroy, annihilate</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: eluo, diluo, diruo, exstinguo, everto, demolior, destruo). </sense><sense id="n12881.1" n="I" level="1"> Of objects not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">si certo tempore luna Gignitur et certo deletur tempore rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:748" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 748</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly before, nova luna <hi rend="ital">creari ... aborisci</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">si Juppiter saepe urbes delevit, fruges perdidit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 131</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">urbem Numantiam, Carthaginem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DELI" /> 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 6, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:219 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 219 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnam Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen Aequorum prope ad internecionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, Volscum nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl></cit>; so of the <hi rend="ital">blotting out, effacing, obliterating</hi>, of writing, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 14, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stigmata in facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 110, § 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:56 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 56 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n12881.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to finish, stop, terminate, end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia, futura bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes leges una rogatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia morte, id. Lael, 4, 13: omnem memoriam discordiarum oblivione sempiterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 13, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec si quid olim lusit Anacreon, Delevit aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: deleo omnes dehinc ex animo mulieres (i. e. memoriam mulierum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem (simulatio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem molestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbitatem (with exstinguere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 8, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turpitudinem fugae virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priorem ignominiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12881.3" n="II" level="1"> Of personal objects: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersis ac paene deletis hostibus,</quote> <trans><tr>destroyed, annihilated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so milit.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 37, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 70</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 10, 24 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:898 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 898 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines morte deletos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto animante deleto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:37:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 37, 90</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">rarely of a single person: C. Curionem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vat. 10, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deleticius: <entryFree id="n12882" type="hapax" key="de_le_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlētīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deleo</etym>, <sense id="n12882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from which any thing has been blotted out, effaced</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">charta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 11, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deletilis: <entryFree id="n12883" type="hapax" key="de_le_ti^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlētĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that wipes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">blots out</hi>: spongia, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deletio: <entryFree id="n12884" type="main" key="de_le_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlētĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12884.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an annihilating, destroying</hi>: nostri exercitus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 97, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deletrix: <entryFree id="n12885" type="hapax" key="de_le_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlētrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that annihilates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroys</hi>: sica hujus imperii deletrix, Auct. Harusp. resp. 23, 49.</sense></entryFree>
deletus: <entryFree id="n12886" type="main" key="de_le_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlētus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">annihilation</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delevo: <entryFree id="n12887" type="hapax" key="de_le_vo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lēvo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlaevo</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12887.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to smooth off, make smooth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam acutissimo ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delia: <entryFree id="n12888" type="main" key="De_li^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Delos <sense id="n12888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.</sense></entryFree>
deliacus: <entryFree id="n12889" type="main" key="De_li^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Delos <sense id="n12889.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. C.</sense></entryFree>
delibamentum: <entryFree id="n12890" type="main" key="de_li_ba_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>delibo</etym>, <sense id="n12890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wine poured out to the gods, a libation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delibatio: <entryFree id="n12891" type="main" key="de_li_ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away from, diminishing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">hereditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:113" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 22</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12891.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The first fruit, sample, representative portion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si delibatio sancta est, et massa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:11:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 11, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliberabundus: <entryFree id="n12892" type="main" key="de_li_be^ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delibero</etym>, <sense id="n12892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">weighing carefully, considering, reflecting, deliberating</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">consules velut deliberabundi capita conferunt, diu colloquuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 54, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliberamentum: <entryFree id="n12893" type="hapax" key="de_li_be^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deliberation</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 6" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliberatio: <entryFree id="n12894" type="main" key="de_li_be^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deliberation, consultation, consideration</hi> (a Ciceron. word; elsewhere very rare). </sense><sense id="n12894.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deliberationes eas, quas habebat domi de republica, principes civitatis adhibebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:12:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 12, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inciditur omnis jam deliberatio, si intellegitur non posse fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:82:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 82, 336</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod in deliberationem cadit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habet res deliberationem,</quote> <trans><tr>needs consideration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilii capiendi,</quote> <trans><tr>respecting the resolution to be adopted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 15, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">neque recte an perperam (factum) interpretor: fuerit ista ejus deliberatio, qui bellum suscepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12894.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. in rhetor. lang. i. q. causa deliberativa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliberativus: <entryFree id="n12895" type="main" key="de_li_be^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">relating to deliberation, deliberative</hi> (only in rhetor. lang., esp. freq. in Quint.): <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 51, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">6: causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; <pb n="538" /> <cb n="DELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:16" default="NO">3, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:56" default="NO">3, 6, 56</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <itype>deliberativa, ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliberator: <entryFree id="n12896" type="hapax" key="de_li_be^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who deliberates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
deliberatus: <entryFree id="n12897" type="main" key="de_li_be^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from delibero.</entryFree>
delibero: <entryFree id="n12898" type="main" key="de_li_be^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lībĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>de and libro, libra; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 1</bibl> Müll.: <hi rend="ital">deliberare a libella</hi>, qua quid perpenditur dictum</etym>, <sense id="n12898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to weigh well</hi> in one's mind, <hi rend="ital">to consider maturely, deliberate</hi> respecting a thing; <hi rend="ital">to take counsel, consult, advise upon</hi> (freq. and class.; for syn. cf. cogito, agito, volvo, reputo, perpendo, meditor, commentor, consulo). </sense><sense id="n12898.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. </sense><sense id="n12898.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">re deliberata, post diem tertium ad Caesarem reversuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">re deliberata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delibera hoc, dum ego redeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de summa rerum deliberare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de geographia etiam atque etiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de necanda filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de singulis articulis temporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 4 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberare Velitne an non,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum ... an (with concoquere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:15:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 15, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an recipiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quando incipiendum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego amplius deliberandum censeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 4, 17</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:35 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 35 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 21, 13</bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo de salute fortunisque alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum judicibus quasi deliberamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum cupiditate id est cum animi levissima parte deliberat,</quote> <trans><tr>takes counsel of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:34:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 34, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum re praesenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 117</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberatur de Avarico in communi concilio, incendi placeret an defendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut utri potissimum consulendum sit deliberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:58:174 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 58, 174 al.</bibl></cit> —<hi rend="ital">Prov.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliberando saepe perit occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:140" default="NO"><author>Pub. Syr.</author> 140</bibl></cit> (Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">deliberandum est saepe, statuendum est semel,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0622,001:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 132</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12898.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12898.4" n="1" level="3"> (Like consulo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.
