B. 1.) <hi rend="ital">To consult an oracle</hi> (only in Nepos): <cit><quote lang="la">ex his delecti Delphos deliberatum missi sunt ... his consulentibus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">so with consulere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Them. 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12898.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: deliberari, <hi rend="ital">to be maturely discussed</hi>, hence <hi rend="ital">to be in doubt</hi>, usually with potest, non potest, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex eo deliberari poterit, ducenda necne alvus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:13:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 13, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque maneatis aut abeatis deliberari potest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>you must certainly go away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 35, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Aemilius, qui pejor an ignavior sit, deliberari non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fr. 1:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fr. 1, 48, 3</bibl></cit>. Cf.: nemo deliberat, <hi rend="ital">no one doubts</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 35, 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12898.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (causa pro effectu), <hi rend="ital">to resolve, determine</hi>, after deliberation (rare in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.;</hi> usually in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">quod iste certe statuerat ac deliberaverat non adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: (Cleopatra) deliberata morte ferocior, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 37, 29</bibl>: certum ac deliberatum est me illis obsequi, Turpil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 282, 11</bibl>, and 429, 21; <cit><quote lang="la">so with certum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum mihi deliberatum et constitutum sit ita gerere consulatum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:8:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 8, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic habuisti statutum cum animo ac deliberatum, omnes judices reicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41</bibl></cit>: deliberatum est non tacere amplius, Afran. ap. Interpr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 564</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlībĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., resolved upon, determined, certain</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque illi quicquam deliberatius fuit quam me ... evertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instructius deliberatiusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:13:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 13, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delibo: <entryFree id="n12899" type="main" key="de_li_bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lībo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to take off, take away a little</hi> from any thing; of food, <hi rend="ital">to taste</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12899.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvam delibet ab aequore partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paululum carnis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 136, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. cenas (opp. edere), Favor. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12899.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12899.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take, enjoy, pluck, gather</hi>: flos delibatus populi Suadaeque medulla, <hi rend="ital">the picked flower of the people</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:15:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 15, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omni ex genere orationem aucuper et omnes undique flosculos carpam atque delibem,</quote> <trans><tr>cull</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex universa mente divina delibatos animos habere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum honorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to taste, enjoy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">honores parcissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cb n="DELI" /> oscula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 434</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 24, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:169" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia narratione,</quote> <trans><tr>to touch upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:38" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl>: delibor, <hi rend="ital">I am ripe for plucking</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">about to die</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Tim. 4, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12899.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To take away, detract from, diminish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque úlla Res animi pacem delibat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de laude jejuni hominis delibare quicquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de honestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:58:174" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 58, 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de gloria sua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 39, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de virginitatis integritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:40" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castitatem virginis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:68" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec vitam ducendo demimus hilum Tempore de mortis nec delibare valemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1088 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1088 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Delibata deum per te tibi numina sancta Saepe oberunt,</quote> <trans><tr>disparaged</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ille (Gracchus) nulla voce delibans insitam virtutem concidit tacitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delibro: <entryFree id="n12900" type="main" key="de_li_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lī^bro</orth>, no <sense id="n12900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>3. liber</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to take off the rind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bark, to peel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 11, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 24, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:11:1" default="NO">5, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 7</bibl></cit>. In <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1088" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1088</bibl>, the true reading is delibare (q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
delibuo: <entryFree id="n12901" type="main" key="de_li^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum</itype> (dēlībūta comas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 312</bibl>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>LIBUO = <foreign lang="greek">lei/bw</foreign>, cf. <foreign lang="greek">a)lei/fw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n12901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to besmear, anoint</hi> with a liquid: delibuo <foreign lang="greek">katabre/xw, e)laiw=, bre/xw</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill. (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> only late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n12901.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12901.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Verb. finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum unguentis delibuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 12</bibl></cit>: unguentis delibuitur, Tert. Cor. mil. 12.—</sense><sense id="n12901.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis medicamentis propter dolorem artuum delibutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl>: delibutus unguentis, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 309, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 1, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">capillus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(meretrices) Miserae, ceno delibutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 55</bibl></cit>: tetra sanie, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">atro cruore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 17, 31</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dona (Medeae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra pingui ceroto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:98:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 98, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Amos, 6, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12901.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">delibutus gaudio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senium luxu delibutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delicate: <entryFree id="n12902" type="main" key="de_li^ca_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcāte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. the following, <sense id="n12902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
delicatus: <entryFree id="n12903" type="main" key="de_li^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deliciae</etym>. <sense id="n12903.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That gives pleasure</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">alluring, charming, delightful; luxurious, voluptuous</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12903.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in illo delicatissimo litore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicatior cultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicati hortuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so often of places: muliebri et delicato ancillarum puerorumque comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:10:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates (with molles and obscenae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:40:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 40, 111</bibl></cit> and 113; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">molliores et delicatiores in cantu flexiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:144" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes hominis libidines delicatissimis versibus exprimere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculos scribens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:50:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 50, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12903.2" n="(b)" level="5"> As a flattering appellation: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tu es delicata?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12903.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soft, tender, delicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">capella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puella tenellulo delicatior haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anio delicatissimus amnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 8:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicatior teneriorque cauliculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:22:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 22, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12903.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Addicted to pleasure; luxurious, voluptuous;</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subst., a voluptuary, a wanton</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12903.5" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">adolescens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:35:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 35, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">odia libidinosae et delicatae juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: quosdam e gratissimis delicatorum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of the paramours</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">paidikw=n</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>; cf. in the <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Flavia Domitilla, Statilii Capellae delicata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">et luxuriosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:28:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 28, 54</bibl></cit>; in inscriptions, delicatus and delicata simply mean <hi rend="ital">favorite slave</hi> (cf. our terms <hi rend="ital">valet</hi> and <hi rend="ital">chamber-maid</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2801</bibl>-2805 and 4650.—</sense><sense id="n12903.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12903.7" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Spoiled with indulgence, delicate, dainty, effeminate</hi>: nimium ego te habui delicatam (<hi rend="ital">I have spoiled you</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum cursum delicati minutis passibus frangunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:9:4:113" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 9, 4, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:132" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12903.8" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Fastidious, scrupulous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">vah delicatus!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 37</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcātē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n12903.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Delicately, luxuriously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicate ac molliter vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. recubans (coupled with molliter), <cb n="DELI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl>; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tractare iracundos (with mollius), Sen. de Ira, 3, 9: odiosa multa delicate jocoseque fecit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:29:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 29, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12903.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">At one's ease, tardily, slowly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">conficere iter (coupled with segniter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spargit se vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 179</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delicia: <entryFree id="n12904" type="main" key="de_li^ci^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. deliciae, <sense id="n12904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12905" type="main" key="de_li^ci^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deliquo, cf. colliciae, a flowing or running off; hence</etym>, <sense id="n12905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gutter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
deliciae: <entryFree id="n12906" type="main" key="de_li^ci^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<number>sing.</number> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; <sense id="n12906.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">ante-and post-class.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 152</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1014, 5</bibl>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Copa, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:50:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 50, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:98:1" default="NO">13, 98, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 680</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1724</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2679</bibl> sq.; 4394; 4958. And <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Inscr. Don. cl. 1, 132, and ap. Gorium Columb. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:page=73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> p. 73</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 4) [delicio; that which allures, flatters the senses], <hi rend="ital">delight, pleasure, charm, allurement; deliciousness, luxuriousness, voluptuousness, curiosities of art; sport, frolics</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.; for syn. cf.: voluptas, libido, delectatio, oblectatio, delectamentum, oblectamentum). </sense><sense id="n12906.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatio amoenitatum ad delectationem, aut supellectilis ad delicias, aut epularum ad voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 8, 10</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciarum causa et voluptatis cives Romanos cum mitella saepe vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum deliciarum comes est extrema saltatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliciis diffluentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 31</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Herodotus Thucydidesque longissime a talibus deliciis vel potius ineptiis afuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:4" default="NO">12, 8, 4</bibl>: delicias facere, <hi rend="ital">to play tricks, to joke, to make sport of</hi> one, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">83</bibl>; on the contrary, <hi rend="ital">to sport</hi> as lovers, Catull. 45, 24; <cit><quote lang="la">72, 2: amores et hae deliciae quae vocantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">votorum,</quote> <trans><tr>a dallying with, fondly prolonging</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:291" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 291</bibl></cit>: ecce aliae deliciae (<hi rend="ital">pretensions</hi>) equitum vix ferendae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse in deliciis alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to be any one's favorite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid in deliciis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere aliquem in deliciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in deliciis vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 9</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12906.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of living beings: <hi rend="ital">delight, darling, sweetheart, beloved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu urbanus scurra, deliciae popli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea voluptas, meae deliciae, mea vita, mea amoenitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amores ac deliciae tuae Roscius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 36, 79</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and the well-known appellation of Titus: amor ac deliciae generis humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 1</bibl></cit>: C. Sempronium Rufum mel ac delicias tuas, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corydon ardebat Alexim, Delicias domini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 22</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 6, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ne Alexandrinis quidem permittenda deliciis,</quote> <trans><tr>favorite slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegrae solaque libidine fortes Deliciae,</quote> <trans><tr>a voluptuary, minion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 67</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 5, 5, 67</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Plutarch, Anton. 59: delicias hominis,</quote> <trans><tr>a precious fellow!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:47" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 47</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliciaris: <entryFree id="n12907" type="gloss" key="de_li^ci^a_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. delicia</etym>, <sense id="n12907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a gutter</hi>: tegulae, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
deliciatus: <entryFree id="n12908" type="gloss" key="de_li^ci^a_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. delicia</etym>, <sense id="n12908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with a gutter</hi>: tectum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:2" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 2</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
delicio: <entryFree id="n12909" type="hapax" key="de_li^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>lacio, the root of deliciae and delecto</etym>, <sense id="n12909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to allure</hi> one from the right way, <hi rend="ital">to entice, delight</hi>: aliquem, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 277, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliciolae: <entryFree id="n12910" type="hapax" key="de_li^ci^o^lae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭŏlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>deliciae <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n12910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrae, Tulliola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuum, villici filius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliciosus: <entryFree id="n12911" type="main" key="de_li^ci^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deliciae</etym>, <sense id="n12911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">delicious, delicate</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Contr. 10, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia, Cass. Var. 7, 9: mollities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 7, § 727</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of persons,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> de Poen. 1, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> prol. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delicium: <entryFree id="n12912" type="main" key="de_li^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. deliciae <sense id="n12912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
delico: <entryFree id="n12913" type="main" key="de_li^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. deliquo.</entryFree>
delictor: <entryFree id="n12914" type="hapax" key="de_lictor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlictor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>delinquo</etym>, <sense id="n12914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delinquent, offender</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cypr.</author> Ep. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
delictum: <entryFree id="n12915" type="main" key="de_lictum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlictum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>delinquo</etym>, prop. a falling<pb n="539" /> <cb n="DELI" />  short of the standard of law (hence esp. <sense id="n12915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a transgression</hi> against positive law; cf. peccatum, usu. against natural law; cf. also: malefactum, maleficium, facinus, flagitium, scelus, nefas, impietas, culpa), <hi rend="ital">a fault, offence, crime, transgression, wrong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delictum suom Suamque ut culpam expetere in mortalem sinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">delictum in se admittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: majore commisso delicto, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo delictum majus est, eo poena est tardior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 3</bibl></cit>: fatetur aliquis se peccasse et ejus delicti veniam petit: nefarium est facinus ignoscere. At leve delictum est; <cit><quote lang="la">omnia peccata sunt paria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi senatus delicti conscientia populum timet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 27, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:104:5" default="NO" valid="yes">104, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:102:12" default="NO" valid="yes">102, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">defendere delictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:442 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 442 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeoccupatus in delicto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Galat. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostia pro delicto,</quote> <trans><tr>a trespass-offering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Levit. 7, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 141</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">347</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
deliculus: <entryFree id="n12916" type="main" key="de_li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n12916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [delinquo], <hi rend="ital">blemished, defective</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> (cf. Wordsworth, Fragm. and Specim. p. 614 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
delicus: <entryFree id="n12917" type="hapax" key="de_li^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delinquo</etym>, <sense id="n12917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">put away</hi> from the breast, <hi rend="ital">weaned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">porci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:4:16" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">delicum</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a)pogalaktisqe/n</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
delicuus: <entryFree id="n12918" type="main" key="de_li^cuus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcuus</orth>, v. deliquus.</entryFree>
deligo: <entryFree id="n12919" type="main" key="de_li^go1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>lēgi, lectum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>1. lego</etym>, <sense id="n12919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to choose out, to select</hi> (for syn. cf.: lego, coopto, designo, eligo, seligo). </sense><sense id="n12919.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">continuo Amphitruo delegit viros primores principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad eas res conficiendas Orgetorix deligitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: quodsi liber populus deliget, quibus se committat; <cit><quote lang="la">deligetque optimum quemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ex senatu in hoc consilium delecti estis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 9, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 8, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 33</bibl> et saep.; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delectos ordine ab omni centum oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Otho (Celsum) bello inter duces delegit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sibi locum domicilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 29</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">re frumentaria comparata equitibusque delectis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so of soldiers,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:49:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes">49, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delecti Latio et Laurentibus agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:431" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melimela ad lunam delecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 32</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">altaque mortali deligere astra manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:50" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 50</bibl></cit> (3, 30, 50 M. dub.; al. deripere).— </sense><sense id="n12919.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n12919.3" n="A" level="2"> Of fruits, <hi rend="ital">to gather, pick off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:144:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 144, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 112, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12919.4" n="B" level="2"> With the accessory idea of removal to a distance, <hi rend="ital">to choose out and send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take away</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">amentem ex aedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Asin. 3, 3, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senes ac fessas aequore matres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 717</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12920" type="main" key="de_li^go2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (de in the sense of reduction in breadth; cf. devincire), <sense id="n12920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tie together; to bind up, to bind fast</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">homini rostrum deliges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachium superimposito penicillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:17" default="NO">2, 21, 17</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deligatus et plurimis medicamentis delibutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veretra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem proripi atque in foro medio nudari ac deligari et virgas expediri jubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sarmentis circum cornua boum deligatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naviculam ad ripam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad ancoras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, naves ad terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistolam ad amentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 48, 5</bibl></cit>: ad patibulos deligantur, cruci defiguntur, Licinius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 221, 11</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad palum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros ac feminas ad stipitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterius collo ascopera deligata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delimator: <entryFree id="n12921" type="gloss" key="de_li_ma_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīmātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>de-limo</etym>, <sense id="n12921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a filer</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">diar/r(inhth/s</foreign>, Gloss. Cyrill.</sense></entryFree>
delimatus: <entryFree id="n12922" type="hapax" key="de_li_ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-līmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [limo], <sense id="n12922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">filed off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scobem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 11, 26, § 111</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delimitatio: <entryFree id="n12923" type="main" key="de_li_mi^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīmĭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marlcing out, limiting</hi>, Auct. de limit. p. 142 Goes. From</sense></entryFree>
delimito: <entryFree id="n12924" type="main" key="de_li_mi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-līmĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mark out</hi>, Frontin. de agr. qual. p. 38 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
delineatio: <entryFree id="n12925" type="main" key="de_li_ne^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīnĕātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>delineo</etym>, <sense id="n12925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sketch</hi>, <cb n="DELI" /> <hi rend="ital">delineation</hi> (late Lat. for forma, descriptio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delineo: <entryFree id="n12926" type="main" key="de_li_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-līnĕo</orth>, also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīnĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>linea</etym>, <sense id="n12926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sketch out, to delineate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem in pariete carbone,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res. Carn. 20 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
delingo: <entryFree id="n12927" type="main" key="de_lingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lingo</orth>, <itype>linxi, ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lick, lick off</hi> or <hi rend="ital">up</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cochleare plenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leo puerum delinxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Diad. 5, § 6</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">salem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to have a meagre diet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delinificus: <entryFree id="n12928" type="main" key="de_li_ni^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīnĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>dēlīnīmentum, dēlīnĭo and dēlīnītor</itype>, v. delen.</entryFree>
delino: <entryFree id="n12929" type="main" key="de_li^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭno</orth>, no <sense id="n12929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, lĭtum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to besmear</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">delinendus homo est vel gypso vel argenti spuma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delinquentia: <entryFree id="n12930" type="main" key="de_linquenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlinquentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>delinquo</etym>, <sense id="n12930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fault, crime, delinquency;</hi> only in <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 46</bibl> and 47.</sense></entryFree>
delinquo: <entryFree id="n12931" type="main" key="de_linquo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-linquo</orth>, <itype>līqui, lictum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n12931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> delinquerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl> codd.), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a., to fail, be wanting</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12931.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fail, be lacking</hi>, for the usual deficere (cf. 1. deliquium, = defectus—very rare): delinquere frumentum, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 390</bibl>: delinquat aut superet aliquid tibi, Tubero ib.—</sense><sense id="n12931.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.), <hi rend="ital">to fail, be wanting</hi> in one's duty; <hi rend="ital">to commit a fault, to do wrong, transgress, offend;</hi> and, delinquere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to commit, do</hi> something wrong. </sense><sense id="n12931.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">QVOD POPVLVS HERMVNDVLVS HOMINESQVE POPVLI HERMVNDVLI ADVERSVS POPVLVM ROMANVM BELLVM FECERE DELIQVERVNTQVE, etc., an old formula used in declaring war,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">an quia non delinquunt viri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut condemnaretur filius aut nepos, si pater aut avus deliquisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede delinquere (opp. gratis recte facere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 3:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 3, 61, 5</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">in vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in bello miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 46</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">hac quoque in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ancilla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deliquere homines adulescentuli per ambitionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum deliquit amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo jam ut praestet laxitate delinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 94</bibl></cit>.—Of errors in language, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 49</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12931.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc. respect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum caveatur praeter aequum ne quid delinquat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 28, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid erga aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ego tibi deliqui?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 2, 185</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">object. acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flagitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 54 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multo majora deliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,016:33:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Par. 33, 23</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulterium quod pubertate delinquitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:5:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 5, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. delictum.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nihil a me adhuc delictum putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliquatitudo: <entryFree id="n12932" type="main" key="de_li^qua_ti^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquātĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deliquo</etym>, <sense id="n12932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a melting, dropping</hi>, cerae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 67, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliquesco: <entryFree id="n12933" type="main" key="de_li^quesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭquesco</orth>, <itype>lĭcŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to melt away, dissolve, melt</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n12933.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam tua ista in sortiendo sors delicuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi delicuit nondum prior (sc. nix), altera venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hyrie flendo delicuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 381</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:253" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 253</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12933.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to melt away, pine away; to vanish, disappear</hi>: qui nec tabescat molestiis nec frangatur timore nec alacritate futtili gestiens deliquescat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliquia: <entryFree id="n12934" type="main" key="de_li^qui^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquĭa</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gutter</hi>, v. 2. delicia.</sense></entryFree>
deliquio: <entryFree id="n12935" type="main" key="de_li^quio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquio</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-linquio</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>delinquo</etym>, <sense id="n12935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a failure, want</hi>, Gell. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 390</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam causam dico quin mihi et parentum et libertatis apud te deliquio siet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 92</bibl></cit> (Brix, Fleck.; al. deliquium).</sense></entryFree>
deliquium: <entryFree id="n12936" type="main" key="de_li^qui^um1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>delinquo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a want, defect</hi> (rare): solis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an eclipse</hi> (for which freq. defectus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 12, 9, § 54</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 390</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Epit. 45, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis lunaeque deliquia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 594</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n12937" type="hapax" key="de_li^qui^um2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deliquo</etym>, <sense id="n12937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a flowing down, dropping down</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 753</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliquo: <entryFree id="n12938" type="main" key="de_li^quo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭquo</orth> <itype>and</itype> (in the trop. signif.) <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>liquo</etym>, <sense id="n12938.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to clear off</hi> a <cb n="DELI" /> turbid liquid, <hi rend="ital">to clarify, to strain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbi da quae sunt deliquantur ut liquida flant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=106" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 106</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 20, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">passum in alia vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:39:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 39, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12938.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi> by speaking, <hi rend="ital">to explain</hi>: explanare, indicare, aperire, Non. (anteclass.): quid istic sibi vult sermo, mater, delica, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 10</bibl>, and 277, 25 (v. 92, 102 Rib.); so Att. ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 277:29" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> ib. 277, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut tu ipse me dixisse delices (sc. apud erum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliquus: <entryFree id="n12939" type="hapax" key="de_li^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭquus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>delinquo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n12939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wanting, lacking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi nil domi delicuum 'st,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliramentum: <entryFree id="n12940" type="main" key="de_li_ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīrāmentum</orth> (in the Fronto MS. written delēr.), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deliro</etym>, <sense id="n12940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nonsense, absurdity</hi> (in Plaut. and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 5, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 24, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deliratio: <entryFree id="n12941" type="main" key="de_li_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, originally, a going out of the furrow, in ploughing; hence, trop., <sense id="n12941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">giddiness, silliness, folly, dotage, madness</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quod vocant lirare, operiente semina, unde primum appellata deliratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista senilis stultitia, quae deliratio appellari solet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o delirationem incredibilem! non enim omnis error stultitia est dicenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 15, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deliritas: <entryFree id="n12942" type="hapax" key="de_li_ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, i. q. deliratio, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 21</bibl> (v. 139 Rib.).</entryFree>
delirium: <entryFree id="n12943" type="main" key="de_li_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deliro, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, in medical lang., <sense id="n12943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">madness, delirium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 18</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
deliro: <entryFree id="n12944" type="main" key="de_li_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-līro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>de-lira, to go out of the furrow; hence</etym>, <sense id="n12944.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deviate from a straight line</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil ut deliret amussis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 16, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 20, 49, § 180</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12944.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (cf. Vel. Long. p. 2233 P.), <hi rend="ital">to be crazy, deranged, out of one's wits; to be silly, to dote, rave</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">delirat linguaque mensque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 454</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falli, errare, labi, decipi tam dedecet quam delirare et mente esse captum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with desipere and dementem esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Delirat uxor. <hi rend="ital">So.</hi> Atra bili percita est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:95 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 95 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex delirans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbo delirantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1158</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">timore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in extis totam Etruriam delirare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stertinium deliret acumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">acc. respect.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid delirant reges plectuntur Achivi,</quote> <trans><tr>whatever folly the kings commit</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delirus: <entryFree id="n12945" type="main" key="de_li_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlīrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deliro, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n12945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">silly, doting, crazy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dementit deliraque fatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delira furiosaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:985" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 985</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with amens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:18:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 18, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">anus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 68, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mater,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 126</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
deliteo: <entryFree id="n12946" type="spur" key="de_li^te^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭtĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, false read. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 1, 1, § 3</bibl> for dilatantia, v. dilato.</entryFree>
delitesco: <entryFree id="n12947" type="main" key="de_li^tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lĭtesco</orth>, <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [latesco], <hi rend="ital">to hide away, conceal one's self; to lie hid, to lurk</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n12947.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae in cubilibus delitescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: hostes noctu in silvis delituerant, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 3, 1, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ulva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub praesepibus vipera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 340</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">privato loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:1:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinu ancillae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 1, 56 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eo mitteret amicos, qui delitescerent, deinde repente prosilirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 25</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">delituit mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 5, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12947.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things: <cit><quote lang="la">stella cursum conflcit, vespertinis temporibus delitescendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 52</bibl></cit>.—Of a letter: <cit><quote lang="la">ancillae sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 1, 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12947.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to skulk behind, shelter one's self under</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus auctoritate delitesceret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in ista calumnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dolo malo, id. Tull. § 33: umbrā magni nominis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 10</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
delitigo: <entryFree id="n12948" type="hapax" key="de_li_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lītĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12948.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to scold, rail angrily</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iratusque Chremes tumido delitigat ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 94</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delitor: <entryFree id="n12949" type="hapax" key="de_li^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deleo</etym>, <sense id="n12949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an obliterator</hi>: scelerum fratris, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 873</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
delitus: <entryFree id="n12950" type="main" key="de_li^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, <sense id="n12950.0" n="1" level="3"> from deleo, </sense><sense id="n12950.1" n="2" level="3"> from delino. <pb n="540" /> <cb n="DELP" /></sense></entryFree>
delium: <entryFree id="n12951" type="main" key="De_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dh/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n12951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small place in Boeotia, with a temple of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:54:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 54, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:50 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 50 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
delius: <entryFree id="n12952" type="main" key="De_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Delos, <sense id="n12952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.</sense></entryFree>
delmatae: <entryFree id="n12953" type="main" key="Delma^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Delmătae</orth>, <itype>ārum, and its derivatives</itype>, v. Dalmatae.</entryFree>
delminium: <entryFree id="n12954" type="main" key="Delmini^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Delminĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*delmi/nion</foreign>, <sense id="n12954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ancient capital of Dalmatia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delocatio: <entryFree id="n12955" type="hapax" key="de_lo^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lŏcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>loco</etym>, <sense id="n12955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dislocation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delonge: <entryFree id="n12956" type="main" key="de_longe"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-longe</orth>, <itype>or in two words, de longe</itype>, <sense id="n12956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., from afar</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ex. 20, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:29:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 29, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delos: <entryFree id="n12957" type="main" key="De_los"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dh=los</foreign>, <sense id="n12957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small island in the Aegean Sea, one of the Cyclades, the birthplace of Apollo and Diana</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dili</hi>, Mela, 2, 7, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 87, 89, § 202</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 22, § 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 18, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">333</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 1, 17</bibl></cit> and 18 (repeatedly); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:144 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 144 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 27; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 597</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:182" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 182</bibl>; Mela, 3, 5, 2 al. —</sense><sense id="n12957.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n12957.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Delos, Delian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Delos</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 14, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 4, 64</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the same also vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 12</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delius</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:454" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 454</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 329</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:79" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:8 al" default="NO">3, 6, 8 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, folia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the laurel</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the oracle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the secret loves of Apollo</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:573" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 1, 573</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Delia dea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Diana</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 6, 33</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭa</orth>, = Diana, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:537" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 537</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:5 al" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n12957.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the name of a damsel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:57 sq" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 57 sq.</bibl>;
