<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 67</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12957.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēlĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhliako/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Delos, Delian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes, celebrated like the Corinthian,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 4, § 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vasa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34</bibl></cit> and 72; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:70:232" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 70, 232</bibl>. The Delians were famed for the rearing of hens and capons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 139</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, gallinarius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Deliaci manu recisi,</quote> <trans><tr>castrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delotus: <entryFree id="n12958" type="main" key="de_lo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from delavo, <sense id="n12958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">washed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delphi: <entryFree id="n12959" type="main" key="Delphi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphi</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*delfoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n12959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the famous city of the oracle of Apollo in Phocis</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kastri</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphi sub monte Parnaso oppidum clarissimi in terris oraculi Apollinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 3, 4, § 7</bibl></cit>; cf. Mela, 2, 3, 4; Mann. Gr. p. 160 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 332</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 168</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n12959.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n12959.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Delphians, the inhabitants of Delphi</hi>, Catull. 62, 392; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:7 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 7 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:1:1:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12959.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., Delphic, belonging to Delphi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>; he is also called, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphicus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:543" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 543</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:856" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 856</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pytho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laurus Phoebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 30, 15</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the raven</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 122, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <trans><tr>a toilettable, made after the fashion of the Delphic tripod</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit> Zumpt; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum atque aurum non simplex Delphica portat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:66" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 66</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so subst.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2505</bibl></cit> and 3094. And, in a like sense: <cit><quote lang="la">cortina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of the Delphic oracle</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 141, 5</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n12959.4" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Del-phĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Delphi-colo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitant of Delphi</hi>, an epithet of Apollo, Aus. Idyll. de histor. 5.—</sense><sense id="n12959.5" n="D" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Delphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*delfi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a priestess of the Delphic Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 43, 4</bibl>: <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epit. 5, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delphinus: <entryFree id="n12960" type="greek" key="delphi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">delphīnus</orth>, <itype>i, and in the pure Greek form</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>) <orth extent="full" lang="la">delphīn</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype> (once also <case>nom.</case>, delphis, = <foreign lang="greek">delfi/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 699</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. G. 1, 162</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 689</bibl> P.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">delfi/n</foreign>, <sense id="n12960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dolphin</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12960.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">delphinus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:20 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 7, § 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:33:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 33, 4 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:27:77" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 27, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:590" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 590</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:14" default="NO">10, 14</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n12960.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form <hi rend="ital">delphin</hi> (cf. Phoc. Ars, p. 1705 P.); <case>nom.</case> delphin, Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:94" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 94</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> delphīna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 114</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 471</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> delphine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 237</bibl>; <number>plur.</number> <cb n="DELU" /> <case>nom.</case> delphines, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 673</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:10:43 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 10, 43 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> delphinum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:17:25" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 17, 25</bibl> (4, 16, 25 M.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:428 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 428 al.</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> delphinas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 8, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12960.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n12960.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The Dolphin</hi>, a constellation. </sense><sense id="n12960.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> Delphinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:45" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 45</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> delphini, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:57" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 57</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n12960.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Nom.</hi> delphin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:457" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 457</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 720</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> delphina, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:79" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 471</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12960.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A water-organ shaped like a dolphin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12960.8" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Certain showy articles of furniture</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">perhaps mere ornaments on furniture</hi>, so called from their shape, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delta: <entryFree id="n12961" type="greek" key="delta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">delta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> or <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">de/lta</foreign>, <sense id="n12961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fourth letter of the Greek alphabet, delta</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*d</foreign>: non formam at vocem deltae gero Romuleum D, Aus. Idyll. de lit. monos. 14; so (but with gender undetermined) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12961.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, </sense><sense id="n12961.2" n="Delta" level="1"> <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*de/lta</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">nom. prop., the Delta in Lower Egypt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 16, 20, § 121</bibl>; Auct. B. Alex. 27.</sense></entryFree>
deltoton: <entryFree id="n12962" type="greek" key="Delto_ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Deltōton</orth>, i. <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*deltwto/n</foreign>, <sense id="n12962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Triangle</hi>, a constellation, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Caes.</author> German. Arat. 239</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 352</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 3:18" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 3, 18</bibl>; Aus. Ecl. de sign. coel. 4.</sense></entryFree>
delubrum: <entryFree id="n12963" type="main" key="de_lu_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlūbrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>de-luo, the place of expiation</etym>, <sense id="n12963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple, shrine, sanctuary</hi> (class., esp. freq. in poets and in elevated prose; usually in the plur.; for syn. cf.: templum, aedes, fanum, cella, sacellum, sacrarium). </sense><sense id="n12963.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">CONSTRVCTA A PATRIBVS DELVBRA IN VRBIBVS HABENTO, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est mihi tecum pro aris et focis certamen et pro deorum templis atque delubris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. coupled with fana, id. Rab. perd. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante deum delubra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 352</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:309" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 309</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1165" default="NO" valid="yes">1165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:225" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 225</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">248</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 6, 35</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 11, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">idolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:65:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 65, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12963.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu audita ex delubro vox est, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">so coupled with templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Smyrnaei delubrum ejus (sc. Homeri) in oppido dedicaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:chapter=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto delubri culmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Martis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deluctatio: <entryFree id="n12964" type="hapax" key="de_lucta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēluctātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deluctor</etym>, <sense id="n12964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wrestling, a struggle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, p. 139</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delucto: <entryFree id="n12965" type="main" key="de_lucto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lucto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to wrestle, struggle</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus aerumnis deluctavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: deluctavi pro deluctatus sum, Plautus in Trinummo, "cum hisce erumnis deluctavit," <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 468, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deluctor: <entryFree id="n12966" type="main" key="de_luctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-luctor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n12966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to wrestle, to struggle, combat</hi> (only in Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Antaeo deluctari malui quam cum Amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deludifico: <entryFree id="n12967" type="main" key="de_lu_di^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lūdĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mock, banter, make sport of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deludo: <entryFree id="n12968" type="main" key="de_lu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n12968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arch. inf. pass.</hi> deludier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 32</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n12968.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To play false, to mock, deceive, make sport of, delude</hi>. </sense><sense id="n12968.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (rare, but class.), Ter. l. l. in hac re me deludier: <cit><quote lang="la">deludi vosmet ipsos diutius a tribuno plebis patiemini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me dolis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Andr. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum hoc uno responso (Apollo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 344</bibl></cit>: corvum hiantem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:19:33 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 19, 33 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil agere atque deludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12968.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">terra deludet arantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 31</bibl></cit> (3, 7, 31 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">quae sopitos deludunt somnia sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 642</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of one dreaming,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:827" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 827</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem spes delusit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 7</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12968.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To play through, to leave off playing</hi>: gladiatores cum deluserunt, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 27, 69, § 202</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
delumbis: <entryFree id="n12969" type="main" key="de_lumbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lumbis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>lumbus</etym>, <sense id="n12969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lamed in the loins, lamed</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n12969.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">coturnix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 51, § 103</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n12969.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">weakened, enervated; weak, feeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">summā delumbe salivā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dietio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delumbo: <entryFree id="n12970" type="main" key="de_lumbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lumbo</orth>, no <sense id="n12970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to lame in the loins</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n12970.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupede delumbata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 36</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n12970.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> <hi rend="ital">to vend</hi>: radices delumbatae, Plin 19, 6, 33, § 109: lacunaria curva ad circinum delumbata, <hi rend="ital">bent into an arch</hi>, <cb n="DEME" /> Vitr., 6, 5.—* </sense><sense id="n12970.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to weaken, enervate</hi>: sententias (with concīdere), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 69</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin..;</hi> cf. delumbis.</sense></entryFree>
deluo: <entryFree id="n12971" type="hapax" key="de_lu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n12971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to wash out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">off, to cleanse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum aquā mulsā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n12971.1" n="II" level="1"> DELVIT, solvit, Paul. ex Fest. <orth extent="full" lang="la">p</orth>. 73, 16 Müll.</sense></entryFree>
delusio: <entryFree id="n12972" type="hapax" key="de_lu_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deludo</etym>, <sense id="n12972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiving, deluding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 127</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delusor: <entryFree id="n12973" type="main" key="de_lu_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēlūsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deceiver</hi>, Cassiod. comp. ad Ep. Jud. 4.</sense></entryFree>
delustro: <entryFree id="n12974" type="hapax" key="de_lustro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lustro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n12974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to free one from an evil charm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spell, to disenchant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem radice herbae asparagi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
delusus: <entryFree id="n12975" type="main" key="de_lu_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lūsus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> from deludo.</entryFree>
deluto: <entryFree id="n12976" type="main" key="de_lu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-lŭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> * <sense id="n12976.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To daub</hi> or <hi rend="ital">plaster with clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:128" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 128</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n12976.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse from clay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dirt</hi>: Dict. Cretens. 3, 24 Deder.</sense></entryFree>
demades: <entryFree id="n12977" type="main" key="De_ma_des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmādes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhma/dhs</foreign>, <sense id="n12977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a famous Athenian orator who sided with Macedon, a contemporary of Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:26:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 26, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:12 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 17, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:49" default="NO">12, 10, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demadesco: <entryFree id="n12978" type="main" key="de_ma^desco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mădesco</orth>, <itype>dŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to become humid</hi> or <hi rend="ital">moist</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:4:40" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 4, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 73" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demagis: <entryFree id="n12979" type="hapax" key="de_ma^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-măgis</orth>, <itype>valde magis</itype>, <sense id="n12979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very much</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 19 sq.</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 9</bibl> Müll., and Gloss. Philox.: "<hi rend="ital">demagis</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">sfodrw=s</foreign>."</sense></entryFree>
demandatio: <entryFree id="n12980" type="main" key="de_manda_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmandātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>demando</etym>, <sense id="n12980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delivering with commendation, a commending</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demando: <entryFree id="n12981" type="main" key="de_mando"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mando</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to give in charge, to intrust, commit, commend</hi> (not ante-Aug.; cf., on the contrary, commendo; most freq. in Suet.; <cit><quote lang="la">not found in Quint. or Tac.): simul plures pueri unius (sc. paedagogi) curae demandabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem mergendum mari servis ipsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testamentum virgini Vestali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam sauciorum militum legatis tribunisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funeris sui curam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proximam civitatem demandari,</quote> <trans><tr>to be sent there for safety</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conjuges liberosque abditis insulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:12:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 12, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demano: <entryFree id="n12982" type="main" key="de_ma_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-māno</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n12982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to flow down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis sub artus flamma demanat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 11, 1</bibl>; Porc. Latro decl. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes">36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12982.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to descend, be descended from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de patriarcharum genere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
demarata: <entryFree id="n12983" type="main" key="De_ma^ra_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmărāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n12983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of King Hiero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demaratus: <entryFree id="n12984" type="main" key="De_ma^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmărātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhma/ratos</foreign>. <sense id="n12984.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Corinthian, the father of Tarquinius Priscus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12984.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Spartan king, colleague of Cleomenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:10:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 10, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 31, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n12984.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Father of Pythagoras</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:43" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demarcesco: <entryFree id="n12985" type="main" key="de_marcesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-marcesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <sense id="n12985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to fade away, wither</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba ad vesperam demarcescit et decidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Psal. 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demarchia: <entryFree id="n12986" type="greek" key="de_marchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dhmarxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n12986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office and dignity of a demarch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3800 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
demarchus: <entryFree id="n12987" type="greek" key="de_marchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dh/marxos</foreign>, lit. <sense id="n12987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ruler of the people</hi> at Athens, <hi rend="ital">the president of a</hi> demos, <hi rend="ital">a demarch</hi>, answering to the Roman <hi rend="ital">tribune of the people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3720</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dematricatus: <entryFree id="n12988" type="hapax" key="de_ma_tri^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mātrĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>matrix</etym>: nisi dematricati fuerint, <sense id="n12988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bled from the</hi> vena matricalis <hi rend="ital">in the neck</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 4, 7, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl>; 13.</sense></entryFree>
demea: <entryFree id="n12989" type="main" key="De_me^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*dhme/as</foreign>, <sense id="n12989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 19</bibl> et passim.</sense></entryFree>
demeaculum: <entryFree id="n12990" type="hapax" key="de_me^a_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĕācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>demeo</etym>, <sense id="n12990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a passage under ground</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Proserpinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 174, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">demeaculum</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">kataporei/a</foreign>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
demeio: <entryFree id="n12991" type="gloss" key="demeio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">de-meio</orth> <foreign lang="greek">a)fourw=, e)courw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
demens: <entryFree id="n12992" type="main" key="de_mens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <sense id="n12992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., out of one's mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">senses; mad, raving; foolish</hi> (cf. amens) (class. and very freq.; for syn. cf.: amens, excors, vecors, insanus, vesanus, delirus, alienatus mente): qua perturbatione animi quae, sanus cum esset, timebat ne evenirent,<pb n="541" /> <cb n="DEME" />  ea demens eventura esse dicebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summos viros desipere, delirare, dementes esse dicebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit> (for which, delirare et mente esse captum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 94</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ego te non vecordem, non furiosum, non mente captum, non tragico illo Oreste aut Athamante dementiorem putem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Orestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 133</bibl></cit> and 135; 1, 6, 97; 1, 10, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 1, 37, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:1" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pentheus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tranquillo tempestatem adversam optare dementis est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:24:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 24, 83</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem fugis, ah, demens?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tacui demens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 94</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n12992.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf., of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 7, 15 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">furor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:13:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:280" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 280</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strepitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 19, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura alieni pericli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:474" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 474</bibl></cit>: cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 85</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa dementissimi consilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 22, 53</bibl></cit>; Auct. Harusp. resp. 26.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmenter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">foolishly, madly</hi> (rare): tanta res tam dementer credita, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 9, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 259</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dementissime testabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
demensio: <entryFree id="n12993" type="hapax" key="de_mensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>demetior</etym>, <sense id="n12993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demensum: <entryFree id="n12994" type="main" key="de_mensum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. demetior.</entryFree>
demensus: <entryFree id="n12995" type="main" key="de_mensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> demetior.</entryFree>
dementer: <entryFree id="n12996" type="main" key="de_menter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmenter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. demens <sense id="n12996.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dementia: <entryFree id="n12997" type="main" key="de_menti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <sense id="n12997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">f</hi> [demens], <hi rend="ital">the being out of one's mind; insanity, madness; folly</hi> (freq. and class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: amentia, furor, rabies, vecordia, insania, deliratio, vesania): animi affectionem lumine mentis carentem nominaverunt amentiam eandemque dementiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:705" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 10, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 42, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 465</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 601</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:233" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:45" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:225 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 225 al.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">plur., follies</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dementio: <entryFree id="n12998" type="main" key="de_menti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmentĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n12998.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be out of one's senses, to be mad, to rave</hi> (anteand post-class.): dementit deliraque fatur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 464</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sese mea magia in amorem inductam dementire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 324, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquis instinctu daemonis percitus dementit, effertur, insanit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
demento: <entryFree id="n12999" type="main" key="de_mento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmento</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n12999.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to drive mad, to craze, deprive of mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dementatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Amic. 21</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">e)cista/nai i)diwtikw=s</foreign>, Gloss. Graec. Lat.; esp. <hi rend="ital">to bewitch, delude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">propter quod magiis suis dementasset eos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n12999.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neut., to rave, be out of one's mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper dementabat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Pers. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demeo: <entryFree id="n13000" type="main" key="de_me^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĕo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to go down, descend</hi> (post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">caelo, Ap. M. 10, p. 254, 12: ad Tartarum Manesque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6</bibl></cit>, p. 180, 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, p. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demereo: <entryFree id="n13001" type="main" key="de_me^re^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĕrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13001.0" n="I" level="1"> With <case>acc.</case> rei, <hi rend="ital">to merit, deserve a thing</hi> (ante-and post-class., and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid mercedis domino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandem pecuniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demeritae laetitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13001.1" n="II" level="1"> (Since the Aug. per.) With <hi rend="ital">acc. pers., to deserve well of, to oblige</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">avunculum magnopere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi sit servos demeruisse pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 252</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimine te potui demeruisse meo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Her. 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrona amoenitate aliqua demerenda erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 8</bibl></cit>. In this signif. usually in the deponent form, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĕrĕor</orth> (not ante-Aug.): ut pleniori obsequio demererer amantissimos meos, Quint. prooem. § 3; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium et Caesarem, quorum nemo alterum offendere audebat, nisi ut alterum demereretur, simul provocavit,</quote> <trans><tr>lay under obligation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104:33" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demerendi beneficio tam potentem civitatem occasio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Regulo demerendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 21 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
demergo: <entryFree id="n13002" type="main" key="de_mergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mergo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sink, submerge, to plunge into, to dip</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13002.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">candens ferrum in gelidum imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars remorum demersa liquore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 441</bibl></cit>; cf.: cornix demersit caput, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">and demersis aequora rostris Ima petunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marium senile corpus paludibus occultasse demersum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 22, 50</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:32:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 32, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 2, 6, § 15</bibl></cit>: triremem hostium perforare et demergere,<cb n="DEME" />  Auct. B. Alex. 25, 5; 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos mari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib 2</bibl></cit>; and in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of a person: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementi circio bis paene demersus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebem in fossas cloacasque exhauriendas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to busy, employ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum in undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:18:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 18, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 17, 9 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">metalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 33</bibl></cit> prooem.: stirpem, <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set in, to plant</hi> (with deponere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18, 2 sq.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">surculos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dapes in alvum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 105</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:664" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 664</bibl>: si quando nos demersimus, ut qui urinantur, Cic. Ac. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 474, 27</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla demersere humeris (i. e. absconderunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:850" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 850</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13002.2" n="B" level="2"> Esp. of the sun-god, etc., <hi rend="ital">to sink</hi> in the sea, <hi rend="ital">cause to set</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sex ubi sustulerit totidem demerserit orbes purpureum rapido qui vehit axe diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:517 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 517 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Titan igniferi tantum demerserat orbis, quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:41 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 41 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13002.3" n="C" level="2"> Intrans., <hi rend="ital">to set</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">demergit sol et nascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> 34, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13002.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to sink, depress, overwhelm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus depressus et quasi demersus in terram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demersae leges alicujus opibus, emergunt aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriam demersam extuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:31:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 31, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and concidit domus, ob lucrum demersa exitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs aere alieno demersa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rheam in perpetuam virginitatem demersit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 43, 2</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">depressed. —Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulsus, Coel. Am. Acut. 2, 32, 165: qui demersiora scrutantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> Origen in Cant. 3, p. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demersio: <entryFree id="n13003" type="main" key="de_mersi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmersĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>demergo</etym>, <sense id="n13003.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a being sunk down, a sinking</hi> (late Lat. and rare). </sense><sense id="n13003.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 40, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13003.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporalis (animae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
demersus: <entryFree id="n13004" type="main" key="de_mersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from demergo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13005" type="hapax" key="de_mersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>demergo</etym>, <sense id="n13005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sinking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levia sustentatui, gravia demersui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 287, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demessus: <entryFree id="n13006" type="main" key="de_messus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmessus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from demeto.</entryFree>
demetior: <entryFree id="n13007" type="main" key="de_me_ti^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mētĭor</orth>, <itype>mensus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n13007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to measure out, to measure</hi>, as a whole (whereas dimetior is to measure the parts of a whole—very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ut verba verbis quasi demensa et paria respondeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:12:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 12, 38</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 124</bibl> (al. dimensis): vos meministis quot calendis petere demensum cibum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the stated allowance</hi> of slaves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 3</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmensum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a measured allowance, ration</hi> of slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ille unciatim de demenso suo comparsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Hadr. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2849</bibl>; cf. Donat. ad Ter. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 40</bibl> Orelli.—In a comic transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc argumentum vobis demensum dabo, Non modio neque trimodio, verum ipso horreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demeto: <entryFree id="n13008" type="main" key="de_me^to1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĕto</orth>, <itype>messŭi, messum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13008.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to mow, reap, cut off, gather, crop, harvest</hi> (class.). Usually of fruits: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora demetendis fructibus et percipiendis accommodata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 70</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 62 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: hordeum, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.: demesso frumento, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 32, 4</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli armati alienos agros demetunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demessa est terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 14</bibl></cit>. 16.—Less freq. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in post-Aug. prose) of other objects: <cit><quote lang="la">pollice florem,</quote> <trans><tr>to pluck off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favos,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cut out, take out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">testes caudamque adultero (ferrum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic ense caput,</quote> <trans><tr>to behead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 104</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies ferro demetit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:102" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n13009" type="main" key="de_me_to2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mēto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. dimeto.</entryFree>
demetrias: <entryFree id="n13010" type="main" key="De_me_tri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmētrĭas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n13010.0" n="I" level="1"> Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dhmhtria/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a city in Thessaly</hi> (Pelasgiotis), <hi rend="ital">newly colonized by Demetrius Poliorcetes</hi>, formerly called Pagasae, now <hi rend="ital">Volo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 8, 15, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:23" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 23</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13010.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmētrĭacus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Demetrias</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (al. Demetraicus).—</sense><sense id="n13010.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sort of plant</hi>, Ap. Herb. 3.</sense></entryFree>
demetrium: <entryFree id="n13011" type="main" key="De_me_tri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmētrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmh/trion</foreign>, <sense id="n13011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Phthiotis, with a temple to Demeter (Ceres)</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13011.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A harbor of Samothrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demetrius: <entryFree id="n13012" type="main" key="De_me_tri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmētrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmh/trios</foreign>, the name of several Greeks, among whom the most celebrated are, <sense id="n13012.0" n="I" level="1"> Demetrius Poliorcetes,<cb n="DEMI" />  <hi rend="ital">son of Antigonus, and king of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:15:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 15, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:1" default="NO">16, 1</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n13012.1" n="II" level="1"> Demetrius Phalereus, <hi rend="ital">a famous orator, a pupil of Theophrastus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 27</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13012.2" n="III" level="1"> Demetrius Magnes, <hi rend="ital">a contemporary of Cicero, and author of a work</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">peri\ o(monoi/as</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13012.3" n="IV" level="1"> Demetrius Pharius, <hi rend="ital">king of Illyria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 33, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13012.4" n="V" level="1"> Demetrius Soter, <hi rend="ital">son of Antiochus the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 34, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13012.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a singer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13012.6" n="VII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A noted cynic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13012.7" n="VIII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A comic actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:99" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl>.— Also, </sense><sense id="n13012.8" n="IX" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The title of a comedy by Turpilius</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 322, 18</bibl>; v. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fr. p. 87 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
demigratio: <entryFree id="n13013" type="hapax" key="de_mi_^gra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmī^grātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>demigro</etym>, <sense id="n13013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emigration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demigro: <entryFree id="n13014" type="main" key="de_mi_^gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mī^gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to migrate from, to emigrate; to depart, remove</hi> from or to a place (class.). </sense><sense id="n13014.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13014.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">de oppidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his aedificiis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex agris in urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Helicone (deae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illa loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hortos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pydnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad virum optimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">demigrandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 23</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to have recourse to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad deos et ad sidera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13014.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to depart this life</hi> (perh. only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">vetat dominans ille in nobis deus, injussu hinc nos suo demigrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 30, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: ex hominum vita ad deorum religionem, id. Rab. perd. 10, 30; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ab improbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13014.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (only in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">multa mihi dant solatia, nec tamen ego de meo statu demigro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strumae ab ore improbo demigrarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
demingo: <entryFree id="n13015" type="gloss" key="de_mingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mingo</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">e)courw=</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
deminoratio: <entryFree id="n13016" type="main" key="de_mino_ra_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēminōrātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deminoro</etym>, <sense id="n13016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">degradation, injury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 22, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deminoro: <entryFree id="n13017" type="main" key="de_mi^no_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĭnōro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lessen, diminish</hi> in honor or rank (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deminuo: <entryFree id="n13018" type="main" key="de_mi^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mĭnŭo</orth>, <itype>ui, ūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13018.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lessen by taking from</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to make smaller, to lessen, diminish</hi> (cf. diminuo, to break up into small parts—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13018.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mina una quinque nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">istum laborem tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 43</bibl></cit> (cf. Wagner ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">ne de bonis quae Octavii fuissent deminui pateretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:3:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 3, § 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:49:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 49, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deminuunt aequora venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 268</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:390" default="NO" valid="yes">390</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deminutae copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:31:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 31, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:64 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 64 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">militum vires inopia frumenti deminuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenore deminuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 58 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13018.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13018.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to take away from, abate, lessen</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">de hujus praesidiis deminuturum putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque de tanta voluptate et gratulatione quicquam fortuna deminuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de jure aut de legibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sua in Aeduos benevoientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de libertate mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex regia potestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui timor studia deminuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem aliquam juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam hujus interdicti (coupled with inflrmata),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem nostri collegii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenitatem imperitantis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:18:21" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 18, 21</bibl></cit> (3, 10, 21 M.) al.: se capite deminuere, <hi rend="ital">to lose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forfeit civil rights, be deprived of citizenship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Top. 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:60:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 60, 15</bibl>; cf. caput, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> III. 1. b.—</sense><sense id="n13018.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. in grammat. lang., <hi rend="ital">to form into a diminutive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacellum ex sacro deminutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:12:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: deminuuntur adverbia, ut <hi rend="ital">primum, primule; longe, longule</hi>, etc., Don. p. 21 Lind. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi> Cf.: deminutus, deminutio, and deminutivus.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĭnūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (very rare), <hi rend="ital">diminished, small, diminutive</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13018.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">deminutior qualitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13018.6" n="B" level="2"> In grammat. lang., <hi rend="ital">diminutive</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">u(pokoristiko/s</foreign> (for which, later, deminutivus): pro nomine integro positum sit deminutum (viz. in the expression <hi rend="ital">magnum peculiolum</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deminutio: <entryFree id="n13019" type="main" key="de_mi^nu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĭnūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deminuo</etym>, <sense id="n13019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diminution, decrease, lessening, abatement</hi> <pb n="542" /> <cb n="DEMI" /> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n13019.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">accretio et deminutio luminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bonis privatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 21, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: tanta de imperio, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multari imperatorem deminutione provinciae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by shortening his term of command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13019.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13019.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: muliebre fastigium in deminutionem sui accipiens (sui, i. e. <hi rend="ital">his own dignity</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl>: mentis, <hi rend="ital">a being out of one's senses</hi> (shortly before, alienata mens), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:99" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 99 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honor aut deminutio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dishonor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 13, 38, § 137</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13019.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. (legal t. t.), <hi rend="ital">the right of alienation</hi> of one's estate: <cit><quote lang="la">uti Feceniae Hispalae datio deminutio esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 19, 5</bibl></cit> (Weissenb. ad loc.).—</sense><sense id="n13019.5" n="C" level="2"> Public. t. t.: capitis deminutio, <hi rend="ital">the loss</hi> or <hi rend="ital">forfeiture of civil rights</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:160 sq" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 160 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:3:6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 28, 3, 6, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:3:7:section=1" default="NO">25, 3, 7, § 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Reg. 10, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:17:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 38, 17, 1</bibl>: Poste <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:page=108" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> p. 108</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sandars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst.
