Introd. 40 sq" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. Introd. 40 sq.</bibl></cit>; v. Caput, III. 1. b. —</sense><sense id="n13019.6" n="D" level="2"> In grammat. lang., <hi rend="ital">a diminutive form</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 73</bibl> P.; 128 P. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
deminutivus: <entryFree id="n13020" type="main" key="de_mi^nu_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĭnūtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deminuo, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</etym>, in the later gramm. lang., <sense id="n13020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diminutive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 32</bibl></cit>: nomen, <hi rend="ital">a diminutive</hi>, Don. p. 1744 P. sq.; in this sense often <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēminūtīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 312</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 609 sq.</bibl> et saep: verba (<hi rend="ital">sorbillo</hi> from <hi rend="ital">sorbeo, garrulo</hi> from <hi rend="ital">garrio</hi>), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 827</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĭnūtīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as a diminutive: cymbia</hi> deminutive a <hi rend="ital">cymba</hi> dicta, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 21 al.</bibl>; al. diminutive.</sense></entryFree>
demipho: <entryFree id="n13021" type="main" key="De_mi^pho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmĭpho</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*dhmofw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n13021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character in the Phormio of Terence</hi>, 2, 3, 5 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
demiror: <entryFree id="n13022" type="main" key="de_mi_ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mīror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13022.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to wonder at</hi> a person or thing, <hi rend="ital">to wonder</hi> (for the most part only in the 1st pers. pres., and peculiar to the lang. of conversation). </sense><sense id="n13022.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (with <case>acc.</case> of <hi rend="ital">neut. pron.</hi>, or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">haec ego vos concupiisse pro vestra stultitia non miror: sperasse me consule assequi posse demiror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:36:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 36, 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 27</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with person or thing as object (ante- and post-class.): eum demiror non venire ut jusseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum ejus demiratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:18:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 18, 10</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">audaciam eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:7:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">has ejus intemperies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">*)optikh\</foreign> facit multa demiranda id genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:8:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13022.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, demiror, like our <hi rend="ital">I wonder</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">I am at a loss to imagine</hi> (with a <hi rend="ital">relat. clause</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">demiror qui sciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:3:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 3, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demiror quid sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 109</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 1, 14</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quid mihi dicent? demiror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demiror, ubi nunc ambulet Messenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demisse: <entryFree id="n13023" type="main" key="de_misse_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmissē</orth>, <sense id="n13023.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., low, humbly</hi>, v. demitto, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
demissicius: <entryFree id="n13024" type="hapax" key="de_missi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmissīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>demitto</etym>, <sense id="n13024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hanging down, flowing, long;</hi> of a garment: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicis demissiciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 24</bibl></cit> (for which elsewh. <hi rend="ital">demissis</hi> tunicis, v. demissus).</sense></entryFree>
demissio: <entryFree id="n13025" type="main" key="de_missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmissĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13025.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a letting down, sinking, lowering</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13025.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: storiarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 9, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbae,</quote> <trans><tr>a letting grow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 22, 4</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipei aenei demissiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n13025.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> * </sense><sense id="n13025.3" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to demissus, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. A.): animi, <hi rend="ital">dejection</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:7:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 7, 14</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n13025.4" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">an abatement, mitigation</hi> (opp. accessio), Coel. Aur. Acut. 1, 4.</sense></entryFree>
demissus: <entryFree id="n13026" type="main" key="de_missus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, fr. demitto.</entryFree>
demitigo: <entryFree id="n13027" type="hapax" key="de_mi_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mītĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13027.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to make milder; pass., to become milder, more lenient</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet ipsi quotidie demitigamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demitto: <entryFree id="n13028" type="main" key="de_mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to send down; to drop; to let, sink</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">bring down; to cause to hang</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fall down; to lower, put down, let fall</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13028.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13028.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">picis e caelo demissum flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:257" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 257</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo imbrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelo ancilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam malis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 673</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latum clavum pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">monilia pectoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laenam ex humeris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 263</bibl></cit>: Maia genitum <cb n="DEMI" /> demittit ab alto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 297</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab aethere currum, Ov M. 7, 219: e muro sporta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. 2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in sporta per murum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleam (sc. in terram),</quote> <trans><tr>to put into the ground, plant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:45:2" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 45, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">arbores altius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puteum alte in solido,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to sink deep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triginta pedes in terram turrium fundamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:31" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbusta certo demittunt tempore florem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:670" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 670</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demisit nardini amphoram cellarius (i. e. deprompsit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos (sc. in alvum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:835" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 835</bibl>.—Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to lower</hi>, demittere antennas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. 4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. 4, 41</bibl> Dietsch.; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Alex. 45, 2: cornua (i.e. antennas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:482" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 482</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effugit hibernas demissa antenna procellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma, classem, socios Rheno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: farinam doliis secundā aquā Volturni fluminis, Frontin. Strat. 3, 14, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">and pecora secundā aquā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum artifices demitti infra pectus vetant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 112</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem (opp. attolli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia (opp. allevari), ib. § 79: aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 13, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">auriculas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:289" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demisso capite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job 32, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos per funem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 262</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:461" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 461</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tunicam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stolam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99</bibl></cit> et saep.; often in a violent manner, <hi rend="ital">to cast down, to cast, throw, thrust, plunge, drive</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">equum in flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:33:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 33, 73</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">equos a campo in cavam viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in carcerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad imos Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:884" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 884</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem in ovilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium in jugulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum in ilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sublicas in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:49:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 49, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc stipites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 73, 3</bibl></cit> and 6: <cit><quote lang="la">huc caementa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummum in loculos,</quote> <trans><tr>to put</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calculum atrum in urnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milia sex nummum in arcam nummariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0594,001:Com. v. 108" default="NO"><author>Nov.</author> Com. v. 108</bibl></cit> Rib.: caput ad fornicem Fabii, <hi rend="ital">to bow, stoop</hi>, Crassus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 267</bibl>: tunicam ad talos, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 286, 19</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 39</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quove velim magis fessas demittere naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">navem secundo amni Scodam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 31</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora Stygiae nocti tormentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:695" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 695</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem neci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem Orco,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 398</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 28, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem umbris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:142" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum jugulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum lacubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 12, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offa demittitur faucibus boum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 11, 76, § 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13028.3" n="b" level="4"> Se, or in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form with middle signif., <hi rend="ital">to let one's self down, stoop, descend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(venti vortex) ubi se in terras demisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se inguinibus tenus in aquam calidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad aurem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se demittit ob assem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concava vallis erat, qua se demittere rivi Assuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:334 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 334 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonullae (matres familias) de muris per manus demissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 47, 6</bibl></cit>.— Prov.: demitti de caelo, or simply caelo, <hi rend="ital">to be sent down from heaven</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be of celestial origin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13028.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., milit. t. t. </sense><sense id="n13028.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To send, bring</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">lead down</hi> soldiers into a lower place: <cit><quote lang="la">in loca plana agmen demittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen in vallem infimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites Numidas in inferiorem campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen in Thessaliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 2</bibl>: exercitum in planitiem, Frontin. Strat. 1, 2, 7 al.; and without <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levem armaturam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:28 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 28 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se major pars agminis in magnam convallem demisisset,</quote> <trans><tr>had descended</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 40, 6</bibl></cit>; 7, 28, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 79, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13028.6" n="2" level="3"> Arma demittere, <hi rend="ital">in making a military salute</hi>: armis demissis salutationem more militari faciunt, <hi rend="ital">with grounded arms</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 85, 6. —</sense><sense id="n13028.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cast down, let sink</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">demisere oculos omnes gemitumque dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 612</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vultu demisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:49:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 49, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissis in terram oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also in sleep: cadit inscia clavo Dextera, demittitque oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:41" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:14:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:32:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 32, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultum animumque metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DEMI" /> 133; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 367</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 58</bibl>. hoc in pectus tuum demitte, <hi rend="ital">impress this deeply on your mind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eas voces in pectora animosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 50</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor hoc altius demissus, quo minus profiteri licet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:11" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: cum in eum casum me fortuna demisisset, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">had reduced</hi>, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem in discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim dicendi ad unum auditorem (opp. supra modum sermonis attolli),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 31</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to engage in, enter upon, embark in, meddle with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me penitus in causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">me in res turbulentissimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: cogita ne te eo demittas, unde, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in comparationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in adulationem,</quote> <trans><tr>to descend to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se usque ad servilem patientiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad minora illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § 5: re in secunda tollere animos et in mala demittere, <hi rend="ital">to let it sink</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be disheartened</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 286, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si vicerint, efferunt se laetitia: victi debilitantur animosque demittunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 15, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animos (with contrahere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">animum (with contrahere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:609" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 609</bibl></cit> (desperant, sicut e contra sperantes aliquid erigunt mentes, Serv.); and with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne se admodum animo demitterent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—In geom., t. t., <hi rend="ital">to let fall</hi> a line, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 5, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmissus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., brought down, lowered</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13028.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13028.9" n="1" level="3"> Of localities, <hi rend="ital">sunken, low-lying, low</hi> (cf. dejectus, <hi rend="ital">P. a., no.</hi> I.): <cit><quote lang="la">campestribus ac demissis locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">loca demissa ac palustria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:49:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 49, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13028.10" n="2" level="3"> Of other things, <hi rend="ital">drooping, falling, hanging down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissis umeris esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 22</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.: <cit><quote lang="la">tremulus, labiis demissis,</quote> <trans><tr>with flabby lips</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demisso capite discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tristes, capite demisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demisso vultu,</quote> <trans><tr>with downcast looks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31, 7</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> in Gr. constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dido vultum demissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 561</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissa vulnera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13028.11" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13028.12" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Downcast, dejected, dispirited, low</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">erigebat animum jam demissum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:21:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 21, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse fracto animo et demisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(homines) animo demisso atque humili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demisso animo fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demissa voce loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 320</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihilo demissiore animo causa ipse pro se dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the person: <cit><quote lang="la">quis P. Sullam nisi moerentem, demissum afflictumque vidit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">videsne illum demissum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:10 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 10 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orator in ornamentis et verborum et sententiarum demissior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:24:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 24, 81</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13028.13" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Lowly, humble, unassuming, shy, retiring</hi> (opp. elatus, lofty, proud): <cit><quote lang="la">ea omnia, quae proborum, demissorum, non acrium sunt, valde benevolentiam conciliant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:43:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 43, 182</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multum demissus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit apud vos modestiae locus, sit demissis hominibus perfugium, sit auxilium pudori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 40, 87</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13028.14" n="3" level="3"> Rarely of external condition, <hi rend="ital">humble, poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui demissi in obscuro vitam habent (opp. qui magno imperio praediti in excelso aetatem habent),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13028.15" n="4" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, and in Tacitus, of genealogical descent, <hi rend="ital">descended, derived, sprung</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab alto Demissum genus Aenea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 63</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 35</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:613" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 613</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 58</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> does not occur. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmisse</orth>. </sense><sense id="n13028.16" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic alte, demissius ille volabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:4:23" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 4, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13028.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">humbly, modestly, abjectly, meanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non est ausus elate et ample loqui, cum humiliter demisseque sentiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppliciter demisseque respondere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 10, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se tueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: haec quam potest demississime atque subjectissime exponit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
demiurgus: <entryFree id="n13029" type="greek" key="de_mi^urgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmĭurgus</orth>, or acc. to the Dor. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dāmĭurgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dhmiourgo/s</foreign>, Dor. <foreign lang="greek">da=miourgo/s</foreign>. <sense id="n13029.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The chief magistrate in some of the Grecian states</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:30" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 30</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">title of a comedy</hi> of Turpilius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 12 al.</bibl>; cf. R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. p. 89 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13029.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Maker of the world</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 24</bibl>. <pb n="543" /> <cb n="DEMO" /></sense></entryFree>
demo: <entryFree id="n13030" type="main" key="de_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi</itype> (msi), mptum (mtum), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>contr. from de-emo; cf. adimo and abemito</etym>, <sense id="n13030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take off, take away, to withdraw, subtract, remove</hi> (class. and very freq.; for syn. cf.: adimo, eripio, furor, rapio, prehendo, capio, sumo, excipio). </sense><sense id="n13030.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">addita demptaque quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:770" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 770</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquid additur aut demitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ad eas (leges) addi demi mutarive vellet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lubet scire quantum auri erus sibi dempsit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 4, 4, 14</bibl></cit> (for which, shortly after, sibi novem abstulit): <cit><quote lang="la">aurum sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secures de fascibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clipea de columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 51</bibl></cit>: de capite (<hi rend="ital">from the sum total</hi>) medimna DC, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 35</bibl> (twice): una dempta uncia <hi rend="ital">deunx, dextans</hi> dempto sextante, <hi rend="ital">dodrans</hi> dempto quadrante, <hi rend="ital">bes</hi> dempto triente, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=172" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 172</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">de stipendio equitum aera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hilum de tempore mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">partem de die,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 20</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam minimum ex osse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus ab arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum a vellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 214</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">simple abl.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus arbore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:324" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 324</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 74</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">juga bobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla pedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 168</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vincula nobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem supercilio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 94</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">soleas (when about to recline at table),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 212</bibl>: haec (epistola) casu ad turrim adhaesit ... dempta ad Ciceronem defertur, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:5:48:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 5, 48, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">odorem vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:110" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbam,</quote> <trans><tr>to shave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13030.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla dies nobis maerorem e pectore demet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:921" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 921</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">mihi et tibi et illis molestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis acerbam necessitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 102:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 102, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus dignitatis patribus (with detrahere, and opp. addere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia furto,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to disclose the theft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 700</bibl></cit> et saep.—Without a <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metum omnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sollicitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curas his dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:775" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 775</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 153</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex dignitate populi (opp. adicere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de vi magistratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex ipsa per se dempto auctore,</quote> <trans><tr>even without its author</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dempto fine,</quote> <trans><tr>without end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:2" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">addere aut demere ad haec (verba),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Mac. 8, 30.</sense></entryFree>
demochares: <entryFree id="n13031" type="main" key="De_mo^cha^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏchăres</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Athenian orator and historian, nephew of Demosthenes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 286 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Ira. 3:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Ira. 3, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
democritus: <entryFree id="n13032" type="main" key="De_mo_^cri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmō^crĭtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmo/kritos</foreign>. <sense id="n13032.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated philosopher born at Abdera, an adherent of the Eleatic school, and the originator of the atomic theory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:372" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 372</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 17 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:297" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 297</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:34 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 34 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13032.1" n="B" level="2"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n13032.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏcrĭtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Democritus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi,</quote> <trans><tr>his followers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 34</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl>: Democritii, see the foll.).—</sense><sense id="n13032.3" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dē-mŏcrĭtēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmokri/teios</foreign>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaxarchus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nausiphanes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 26</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏcrĭtīi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">his followers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10, 42</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13032.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏcrĭtēa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the doctrines of Democritus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:26:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 26, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13032.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of Sicyon, friend of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demodocus: <entryFree id="n13033" type="main" key="De_modo^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmodŏcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a companion of Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:413" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 413</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demogrammateus: <entryFree id="n13034" type="main" key="de_mogramma^teus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmogrammăteus</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dhmogrammateu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public scribe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 69, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demoleon: <entryFree id="n13035" type="main" key="De_mo^le^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏlĕōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmole/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n13035.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a centaur slain by Perseus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 356</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">368</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demoleos: <entryFree id="n13036" type="main" key="De_mo^le^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏlĕos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian chieftain before Troy, slain by Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:260 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 260 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demolio: <entryFree id="n13037" type="main" key="de_mo_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmōlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n13037.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> !*?.</sense></entryFree>
demolior: <entryFree id="n13038" type="main" key="de_mo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-mōlĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype>, <sense id="n13038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to cast off, remove</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13038.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. So only once in a trop. sense: <cit><quote lang="la">culpam de me demolibor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13038.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of buildings, <hi rend="ital">to throw down, pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear down, demolish</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cb n="DEMO" /> deleo, eluo, diluo, diruo, everto, destruo). </sense><sense id="n13038.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">monimenta virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 242</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">(Lachm. lamenta): domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:4:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 4, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columnas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: munitiones, Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 22</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum immortalium templa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13038.4" n="b" level="4"> Of inanimate subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus et statuas, aras etiam templaque demolitur et obscurat oblivio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:55:9" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 55, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13038.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to demolish, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevi prioris Robora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quod cuiquam privatim officiet jus, id destruet ac demolietur, quid attinebit? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchanalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to disfigure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 6, 16</bibl></cit> (as a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)fani/zein to\ pro/swpon</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <trans><tr>lay waste</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:18:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 18, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 51, 2</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi tinea demolitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:19 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 6, 19 sq.</bibl></cit>!*? </sense><sense id="n13038.6" n="a" level="4"> Act. form dēmōlĭo, īre, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 395</bibl> P. (Com. v. 48 Rib.); Varr. ib. Lex ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13038.7" n="b" level="4"> Demolior, īri, in pass. signif., Lex ap. Front. l. l.; Curio ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:4:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:23" default="NO">41, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3015</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demolitio: <entryFree id="n13039" type="main" key="de_mo_li_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmōlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>demolior, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n13039.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tearing down, demolishing</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13039.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ea demolitio (statuarum) fieret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n13039.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatis,</quote> <trans><tr>an undermining</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demolitor: <entryFree id="n13040" type="hapax" key="de_mo_li_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmōlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which breaks down, a demolisher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corvus quem nonnulli gruem appellant (a sort of warlike engine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstrabilis: <entryFree id="n13041" type="hapax" key="de_monstra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>demonstro</etym>, <sense id="n13041.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">demonstrable</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 3, p. 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstratio: <entryFree id="n13042" type="main" key="de_monstra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13042.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pointing out</hi>, as with the finger, <hi rend="ital">an indication, description, designation</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13042.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">gestus universam rem et sententiam non demonstratione sed significatione declarans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conversam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus generis demonstratio est, et doctrina ipsa vulgaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:55:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 55, 209</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 13, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13042.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13042.3" n="A" level="2"> In rhetor. </sense><sense id="n13042.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The demonstrative</hi> or <hi rend="ital">laudatory kind of oratory</hi>, i. q. demonstrativum genus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:115" default="NO">11, 3, 115</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13042.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A vivid delineation, picturesque presentation</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diatu/pwsis e)ne/rgeia</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 55, 68</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13042.6" n="B" level="2"> In jurisprud., <hi rend="ital">a clear and complete declaration of one's will</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:35" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 35</bibl>, tit. 1: <cit><quote lang="la">de condicionibus et demonstrationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 17" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> ib. 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:30:1:74" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 30, 1, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13042.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The bounding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">limiting of a place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:12" default="NO">10, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstrative: <entryFree id="n13043" type="main" key="de_monstra_ti_ve_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātīvē</orth>, <sense id="n13043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., demonstratively</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
demonstrativus: <entryFree id="n13044" type="main" key="de_monstra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>demonstro</etym>, <sense id="n13044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointing out, designating</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13044.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <trans><tr>the indexfinger, forefinger</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:21" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13044.2" n="II" level="1"> In rhetor., <hi rend="ital">demonstrative</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">e)gkwmiastiko/n</foreign>: genus (orationis), <hi rend="ital">a branch of rhetoric employed in praising</hi> or <hi rend="ital">censuring</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">laudatory</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vituperative</hi> (usuually the former), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:5:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:11" default="NO">2, 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:53" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:48" default="NO">11, 1, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 21, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. 7, 4, 2.—</sense><sense id="n13044.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">demonstrative kind of oratory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:63 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 63 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:8" default="NO">3, 8, 8</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātīvē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">demonstratively</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstrator: <entryFree id="n13045" type="main" key="de_monstra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13045.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who points out</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indicates; an indicator, exhibiter</hi> (very rare): uniuscujusque sepeliendi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:86:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 86, 353</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus rationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 10, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicinarum Aesculapius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstratorius: <entryFree id="n13046" type="main" key="de_monstra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēmonstrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>demonstrator</etym>, <sense id="n13046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointing out, indicating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitus,</quote> <trans><tr>the index-finger</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 11, 1, 70</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demonstro: <entryFree id="n13047" type="main" key="de_monstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-monstro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n13047.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">arch. inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstrarier,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 76</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to point out</hi>, as with the finger; <hi rend="ital">to indicate, designate, show</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n13047.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13047.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (cf.: indico, significo, ostendo): ubi habitet (mihi) demonstrarier<cb n="DEMO" />  (volo—with commonstrarier), Ter. l. l.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera ipsa ita putavi esse demonstranda, ut commonstrarem tantum viam, et ut fieri solet, digitum ad fontes intenderem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ea figura, quae digito demonstrari potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">too, aliquid digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem averso pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid nutu vel manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum volo mihi demonstretis hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesaurum mi in hisce aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:1:2:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 1, 2, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera cum cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unum ex iis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:94" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 94</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante demonstrabant, quid ubique esset ... item nunc, quid undique oblatum sit, ostendunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59</bibl></cit>: demonstres ubi sint tuae tenebrae, Catull. 55, 2.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: histrio ita demonstraverat (<hi rend="ital">had gesticulated</hi>), ut bibentem natantemque faceret, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> of a subject not personal: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstrant astra salebras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:16:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 16, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 15, 15 M.).—</sense><sense id="n13047.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., jurid. t. t.: fines, <hi rend="ital">to point out the boundaries</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">to deliver</hi> a piece of land to the purchaser, Cic. pro Tull. § 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 18, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:2:45" default="NO">21, 2, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.5" n="C" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to guide by pointing out the way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si equus ille decessit qui demonstrabat quadrigam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:1:65:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 31, 1, 65, § 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to designate, indicate</hi>, by speech or writing; <hi rend="ital">to show, prove, demonstrate; to represent, describe;</hi> also simply <hi rend="ital">to mention</hi> (in this signif. often in Caes. —for syn. cf.: monstro, commonstro, comprobo, probo, declaro). </sense><sense id="n13047.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spurinna quidem cum ei rem demonstrassem et vitam tuam superiorem exposuissem, magnum periculum summae reipublicae demonstrabat, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with docere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 15</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">istius cupiditatem minasque demonstrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tibi nemo responsurus esset, tamen ipsam causam demonstrare non posses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum formamque (sc. navium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">re demonstrata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus demonstratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid scripto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea castra, quae supra demonstravimus, contendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 49</bibl>; so with the <hi rend="ital">pron. relat.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:84:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 84, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 89, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus Hercyniae silvae, quae supra demonstrata est, latitudo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 81, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">63</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">double acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam virtutem quartam elocutionis Cicero demonstrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.8" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi Fabius demonstravit, te id cogitasse facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">demonstrant sibi praeter agri solum nihil esse reliqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 11, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 41, 2</bibl> (with exponunt); 7, 43, 2 et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with <case>nom.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">altera parte imbecillitas, inopia fuisse demonstrabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si eo ipse in genere, quo arguatur, integer ante fuisse demonstrabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 11, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:14" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:2:21" default="NO">2, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.9" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">relative clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta praedae faciendae facultas daretur, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 106, § 169</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.10" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset Caesar in citeriore Gallia in hibernis, ita uti supra demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut supra demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">5, 19 al.: ut ante demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ita ut antea demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply ut demonstravimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:66:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 66, 2 al.</bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) In attraction: <cit><quote lang="la">cum essent in quibus demonstravi augustiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter DC ejus generis, cujus supra demonstravimus naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13047.11" n="b" level="4"> Of an inanimate subject: <cit><quote lang="la">quae hoc demonstrare videantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod proximus demonstrabit liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:49" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">littera causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laus ac vituperatio quale sit quidque demonstrat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:14 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 14 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13047.12" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves XVIII., de quibus supra demonstratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:56:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 56, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant, ut supra demonstratum est, legiones Afranii tres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; 2, 34; <cit><quote lang="la">and without supra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem a Pompeio missum in Hispaniam demonstratum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; so with an <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 42, 5: ad flumen Axonam contenderunt, quod esse post nostra castra demonstratum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
demophilus: <entryFree id="n13048" type="main" key="De_mo^phi^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏphĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmo/filos</foreign>, <sense id="n13048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek comic poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:prol. 10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. prol. 10</bibl>. <pb n="544" /> <cb n="DEMO" /></sense></entryFree>
demophoon: <entryFree id="n13049" type="main" key="De_mo^pho^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēmŏphŏon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*dhmofo/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n13049.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Theseus and Phaedra, a lover of Phyllis, and one of those who fought before Troy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 597</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:24:44" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 24, 44</bibl> (3, 19, 28 M.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 59" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 59</bibl> and 243.—</sense><sense id="n13049.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A companion of Aeneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 675</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
